Title: Front-End Developer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description


Legacy implementation and adaption
Module based TypeScript and React implementation
Issue fixing


Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


Expert in development by using:
Java
CSS, HTML
Typescript
Experience with using NPM
Strong communication skills
A team player


Meritorious


React
Front-end testing, Jest / Vite
Working with embedded systems
GWT
Git
Storybook
Working with open source


Application deadline: 22-02-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About us

Founded in 2015, Instabox is a Sweden-based tech company with the mission to make online shopping easier. In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the merchant at heart.

We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for a Software Engineer with machine learning knowledge to help us govern our journey ahead!

About the role

At the Route Optimization team, you’ll play a crucial role in building, maintaining, and enhancing the models and services that drive our core operations. We follow an end-to-end approach: collecting and preprocessing data, developing and validating models, deploying these models, and integrating them into our routing engine. Your work will directly impact how Instabee optimizes its routes, empowering the business to make informed strategic decisions, improve operational efficiency, and enhance customer satisfaction.

To do this we’ll expect you to:

Build and maintain models and services and deploy them

Take the lead on developing new features and refactoring existing code, ensuring high standards of code quality and efficiency

Stay at the forefront of software development trends, experimenting with new approaches and technologies to continuously improve our systems

Work closely with algorithm engineers, machine learning engineers, and the broader tech team to share ideas and support each other in achieving our goals

Advocate for best coding practices, both within the team and across the organization, inspiring others to maintain high standards




To succeed in this role you probably:

Love writing high-quality production-grade code

Have 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer or Machine Learning Engineer, working in a modern tech environment

Experience in building and deploying machine learning models

Strong programming skills in Python and Java. Experience with various databases is a plus

Familiarity with Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, and other DevOps tools

You’ve led feature development, refactoring efforts, and know how to inspire those around you

If this is you, we really can’t wait to meet you!



What you’ll get

We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!

Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:

🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.
🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
and love to your little one.
🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!


Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.

This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.

Title: Machine Learning Engineering Associate
Description:
We are looking for an innovative and passionate Machine Learning Engineer Associate to join our fast-paced, dynamic team. As a key member of our technology division, you will play a vital role in developing, deploying, and optimizing end-to-end machine learning models. This role demands expertise in MLOps (Machine Learning Operations), Data Science, Data Analisys and the ability to handle the entire machine learning lifecycle—from data ingestion to model deployment and beyond.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Oppizi, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers and product managers, to deliver high-quality ML solutions that directly impact business outcomes. You will also be responsible for ensuring that our models are scalable, efficient, and aligned with the company's goals.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development and Deployment: Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models that address business needs, ensuring high availability and performance in production environments
MLOps and Automation: Apply MLOps best practices to automate the ML lifecycle, including data ingestion, training, and deployment pipelines. Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery
Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Monitor deployed models to ensure they meet performance metrics, and continuously improve them for accuracy and scalability
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with software engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to develop and communicate ML solutions effectively



Requirements

What are you bringing to the team:


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field
Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist or in a similar role
MLOps Expertise: Proven experience with MLOps tools and frameworks (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Extended)
Programming Skills: Strong proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Scikit-learn
Cloud & Containerization: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, and familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
Data & API Proficiency: Experience with data manipulation and building APIs using frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask, or Django
Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Nice to have:


Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools



Benefits

Salary range: 40k-50k USD with performance-based bonuses.

Stock option program

Professional growth opportunities in a fast-growing startup.

Flexible working hours and remote work options.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist

We are seeking a data scientist to join us on the journey of defining Carlsberg's commercial analytics data science strategy and support the creation of advanced analytics and machine learning models to address intricate business challenges at Carlsberg.

Great beers, great colleagues, a focus on personal development and a diverse and inclusive workplace – we’d like you to come and be part of shaping our future.

This is an exhilarating time to join Carlsberg, as we are currently shaping our strategy for leveraging advanced analytics and generative AI to support our ambitious five-year program. You'll also have the opportunity to contribute to key analytical initiatives, such as our Value Management program.

What You’ll Be Doing

Your tasks will mainly consist of:


Collaborating with business SMEs to identify and address business challenges through analytics.
Designing, creating, testing, and deploying complex algorithms to drive analytical solutions across the organization.
Working with IT and business teams to implement scalable and sustainable analytical solutions.
Establishing standards and guidelines to ensure responsible and scalable AI practices throughout the SDLC.
Managing relationships with vendors and strategic tech partners to ensure visibility into our work and to influence vendor product teams in delivering long-term solutions tailored to our needs.


What We’re Looking For


Between 3-5 years of diverse technical experience in delivering statistical analytics, data science, and insights on large-scale data sets.
Proven track record of leveraging data science and advanced analytics to drive business value and transformation.
Strong expertise in Python (including NumPy and pandas) is essential; familiarity with PySpark, Databricks, and Azure is a plus.
Experience with MLOps tools and DevOps practices is advantageous.
Background in developing models for pricing, promotion, and assortment optimization is desirable.
Ability and enthusiasm for coaching and mentoring less experienced data scientists.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels, both internal and external.
Demonstrated experience in planning and managing multiple projects simultaneously.


What You Can Expect

We are a global team who work closely together despite being at a distance and we support each other when needed. We have an informal tone and though we are serious about our work we like to have fun together meeting in “virtual Friday bars”.

We’re geared to work globally and as such the role provides a great opportunity to be flexible; supporting better brewing for tomorrow with work schedules that can support you today.

We encourage you to visit and learn more about our DE&I Strategy: Sustainability » Our ESG programme » Diversity, Equity and Inclusion « Carlsberg Group

If you join our team, some of the benefits you’ll enjoy are:


Flexible, hybrid work model
Annual bonus based on company and individual performance
Unlimited soft and coffee drinks in the office
Monthly beer and soft drink allowance
Well-equipped and comfortable office in the heart of Carlsberg City District in Valby, Copenhagen
Opportunities to have fun together during regular Friday bars
Being part of a company with an enormous heritage and a strong connection with Denmark’s Capital City


About Carlsberg Integrated Information Technology (IIT)

Carlsberg IIT is the global provider of business services to all functions, regions and markets in the Carlsberg Group. This includes business process design, system solutions, shared services and system operations. IIT employs approx. 600 people. A tight collaboration with the local markets is established in all three regions; Western Europe, Eastern Europe and Asia. Carlsberg IIT is situated in Valby, Copenhagen. Carlsberg IIT is overall responsible for the provision of IT and data services across all Carlsberg functions and markets, the words ‘Technology’ and ‘Information’ are given.

The word ‘Integrated’ refers to the fact that the IIT Function will operate in close alignment with the business agenda of functions and regions. Furthermore, ‘Integrated’ hints that services provided by IIT should be a naturally embedded part of our colleague’s work.

Interested?

Apply through the link. Please notice that this is the only way we accept applications.

The deadline for applying is the 24th of February. We read applications continuously, and vacancies may be filled sooner than the deadline, so we encourage you to apply as early as possible.

We look forward to receiving your application.

Carlsberg Group: Brewing for a better today and tomorrow

For us success has always been in the diverse mix of our people, our beers and our brands. At Carlsberg, we want to recruit and develop people with a global mindset, cultural understanding, and international experience to ensure that our organization stays agile, inclusive and prepared for future growth. Only by acknowledging and harvesting from different perspectives and experiences, will we gain competitive advantage and leverage the effect of diversity for business growth. Carlsberg aims to create equal access to opportunity regardless of social identity, and we encourage everyone to apply regardless of gender, nationality, race, religion or any other characteristics protected by law.
Show more
HTML:
Data Scientist

We are seeking a data scientist to join us on the journey of defining Carlsberg's commercial analytics data science strategy and support the creation of advanced analytics and machine learning models to address intricate business challenges at Carlsberg.

Great beers, great colleagues, a focus on personal development and a diverse and inclusive workplace – we’d like you to come and be part of shaping our future.

This is an exhilarating time to join Carlsberg, as we are currently shaping our strategy for leveraging advanced analytics and generative AI to support our ambitious five-year program. You'll also have the opportunity to contribute to key analytical initiatives, such as our Value Management program.

What You’ll Be Doing

Your tasks will mainly consist of:

  • Collaborating with business SMEs to identify and address business challenges through analytics.
  • Designing, creating, testing, and deploying complex algorithms to drive analytical solutions across the organization.
  • Working with IT and business teams to implement scalable and sustainable analytical solutions.
  • Establishing standards and guidelines to ensure responsible and scalable AI practices throughout the SDLC.
  • Managing relationships with vendors and strategic tech partners to ensure visibility into our work and to influence vendor product teams in delivering long-term solutions tailored to our needs.

What We’re Looking For

  • Between 3-5 years of diverse technical experience in delivering statistical analytics, data science, and insights on large-scale data sets.
  • Proven track record of leveraging data science and advanced analytics to drive business value and transformation.
  • Strong expertise in Python (including NumPy and pandas) is essential; familiarity with PySpark, Databricks, and Azure is a plus.
  • Experience with MLOps tools and DevOps practices is advantageous.
  • Background in developing models for pricing, promotion, and assortment optimization is desirable.
  • Ability and enthusiasm for coaching and mentoring less experienced data scientists.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels, both internal and external.
  • Demonstrated experience in planning and managing multiple projects simultaneously.

What You Can Expect

We are a global team who work closely together despite being at a distance and we support each other when needed. We have an informal tone and though we are serious about our work we like to have fun together meeting in “virtual Friday bars”.

We’re geared to work globally and as such the role provides a great opportunity to be flexible; supporting better brewing for tomorrow with work schedules that can support you today.

We encourage you to visit and learn more about our DE&I Strategy: Sustainability » Our ESG programme » Diversity, Equity and Inclusion « Carlsberg Group

  • Annual bonus based on company and individual performance
  • Unlimited soft and coffee drinks in the office
  • Monthly beer and soft drink allowance
  • Well-equipped and comfortable office in the heart of Carlsberg City District in Valby, Copenhagen
  • Opportunities to have fun together during regular Friday bars
  • Being part of a company with an enormous heritage and a strong connection with Denmark’s Capital City

Title: AI/ML Expert
Description:
Spændende karrieremulighed som AI/ML-ekspert hos Trifork!

Om jobbet

Hos Trifork arbejder vi strategisk med machine learning og AI. Sammen med vores kunder udvikler vi værdiskabende løsninger baseret på moderne teknologier herunder Machine Learning / Conversational AI / Vision AI / Generative AI, Cloud løsninger, backend services, web- og mobilapplikationer. Vi udvikler løsninger for såvel store enterprise virksomheder som mindre start-ups.

Er du en passioneret og erfaren AI/ML-ekspert som har en trang til at engagere sig med kunder?

Trifork leder lige nu efter en dygtig profil til at joine vores team og bidrage med cutting-edge AI løsninger til vores kunder. Vi har fokus indenfor AI (Vision/Generative/Conversational) samt Machine Learning. Hvis du trives i et samarbejdende miljø, har en stærk baggrund inden for softwareudvikling og brænder for at gøre en forskel, kunne dette være den perfekte rolle for dig!

Nogle Af Dine Ansvarsområder


Teknisk ekspertise: Udfold din ekspertise inden for AI/ML til at udvikle og levere avancerede løsninger som dækker kundernes behov og være med til at sætte præg på retningen indenfor AI/ML i afdelingen
Kundeengagement: At engagere sig med kunder for at forstå deres behov og samarbejde omkring levering af innovative AI løsninger.
Forretningsudvikling: Udvise flair for og identificere forretningsmuligheder samt være en aktiv spiller ift. udarbejdelse af strategiske salgbare AI/ML løsninger


Hvem er du?


Du er passioneret omkring at arbejde indenfor tech industrien. Du elsker teknologi, software- og applikationsudvikling!
Du har gåpåmod, et positivt mindset og evner at arbejde både selvstændigt og som en god holdspiller
Du har en udadvendt personlighed som bringer god energi, stemning og humor ind på kontoret
Du er en dygtig kommunikator med et stærkt analytisk mindset som hjælper dig med at fokusere på hvad der er vigtigt
Du har en naturlig interesse og forståelse omkring ny teknologi er i stand til at forbinde denne viden i hvordan det hjælper vores kunder


Vi Forventer, At Du Har


En højere videregående uddannelse på kandidat- eller bachelorniveau inden for et IT relevant område
Erfaring indenfor Vision AI, Conversational AI, Generative AI/LLM og Machine Learning
Erfaring med udvikling og levering af succesfulde AI løsninger som du kan fremvise
Et agilt mindset som efterlever de agile principper og gerne vil arbejde med Scrum
Evnerne til at kommunikere og præsentere på et højt professionelt niveau både på dansk og engelsk
Struktureret med et naturligt drive og tilgang til at nedbryde kompleksitet ned til klarhed og actions samt fokusere på de rigtige detaljer på de rigtige tidspunkter
Får energi ved at interagere med forskellige mennesker og bruger din sociale bevidsthed til at skabe et konstruktivt og positivt arbejdsmiljø


Hvad vi tilbyder

Vores daglige arbejde er karakteriseret af en åben og ærlig atmosfære, og vi sætter fokus på at skabe et fagligt udfordrende men også sjovt arbejdsmiljø. Vi afholder fx løbende tech talks til aftenarrangementer, hvor du enten kan lære nyt sammen med andre ansatte og gæster, eller være den, der lærer fra dig.

Vi arbejder i agile multifunktionelle teams med et fokus på tæt samarbejde med vores kunder. Professionel sparring er vigtigt for os, og derfor har du altid en kollega med på din opgave.

Nye medarbejdere får en mentor/buddy tildelt, så der altid er en kollega at spørge hvis der er noget man er i tvivl om. Det er vigtigt for os at nye medarbejdere bliver godt integreret og hurtigt føler sig trygge og som en del af vores afdeling.

Efter de første måneder du er startet hos Trifork, vil du få muligheden for at blive inviteret på vores "Family Training" med vores grundlægger og CEO sammen med andre nye kollegaer fra Trifork kontorer rundt om i verden. Family Training foregår som regel i vores eget Casa Maria på Mallorca.

Trifork - en betroet teknologisk partner

I Trifork tager vi ansvar for kundens løsning og løser deres udfordringer i tæt samarbejde med kunden. Vi har øje for kundens forretning og skaber løsninger der gennem løbende innovation understøtter deres udvikling mange år frem. Vi positionerer os selv med vores kunder som en betroet teknologisk partner, og har en arbejdsmodel hvor vi fokuserer på at sætte det rigtige udvikler-team der arbejder tæt sammen i et agilt setup fra vores eget kontorer.

Ikke mere end 42 mennesker på kontoret

Hvorfor, spørger du så? Vi ønsker at sikre at et kontor ikke bliver for stort, så du altid ved hvem du sidder ved siden af. Ved ikke at have for store kontorer, sikrer vi at have en uformel og afslappet kultur, hvor alle kender hinanden. Det gør også at vi er små autonome enheder og hvor medbestemmelse/indflydelse på hverdagen er en væsentlig faktor. Så på trods af, at Trifork er en virksomhed med mere end 1000 ansatte, så føles det ofte som at arbejde i en startup virksomhed med et stærkt og samarbejdsvenligt miljø, hvor alle kan blive hørt.

Derudover Tilbyder Vi


Hacker Days - to gange om året tager vi to dage væk fra vores kontor, for at dykke ned i helt nye og spændende teknologier (se videoen nedenfor)
GOTO konference - mulighed for at tage på GOTO eller anden relevant konference og lærer om super trends og state-of-the-art teknologier
Uformelt arbejdsmiljø og højt humør
Høj grad af faglighed og vidensdeling mellem udviklere via interessegrupper
Mulighed for at bruge de nyeste teknologier i dine projekter
Årlig strategitur med fokus på teambuilding og virksomhedskultur. De senere år tæller Mallorca, Obertauern, Zürich
Mulighed for Crossfit hver mandag og løbeklub hver torsdag
Mulighed for Scrum master Certificering
Central beliggende kontor midt i Aarhus tæt på offentlig transport eller mulighed for parkering
Spil bordfodbold med dine kollegaer på vores Bonzini bord
Lækker varierende frokostordning
Friskkværnet kaffe brygget på vores fine italienske kaffemaskine
Morgenbrød om mandagen, snacks og frugt, torsdagskage, fredagsrundstykker
Et velassorteret køleskab med både cocio, sodavand m.m.
Fredagsbar
Kvartalsmøder i afdelingen med efterfølgende aktiviteter og spisning
Macbook Pro eller high-end Dell og fri telefon


Vi håber du synes at jobbet og Trifork lyder spændende, og vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning. For at behandle din ansøgning så hurtigt som muligt, vil vi opfordre dig til at du i din ansøgning adresserer de forventninger vi har til dig.
Show more

Title: Biomedical Machine Learning Engineer Intern
Place: Frederiksberg Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join IMP SCANDINAVIA, a dynamic MedTech Start-Up revolutionizing the healthcare sector with our intelligent monitoring technology. We are seeking a motivated Biomedical Digital Signal Processing intern to contribute to our research and development team. If you're a hands-on, self-driven individual with a passion for improving patient outcomes, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

The Job?

IMP is currently looking for a hands-on, self-driven, energetic Biomedical Digital Signal Processing intern to join our research and development team. This position is responsible for developing creative solutions to significant unmet medical needs that align with IMP objectives. The digital signal processing aspect of the work involves innovating new approaches to analyzing human data over time including physiological data.

Responsibilities


Design of advance signal processing algorithms for portable diagnostic devices.
Develop machine learning and deep learning models for various vital sign calculations
Collaborate with our tech stack to operationalize applications, including API development.
Drive product innovation by exploring new ways to improve our offerings.
Document progress and utilize critical thinking for decision-making on implemented methods.


Your daily tasks will be designed in close corporation with the CTO and our R&D team.

Qualifications


Have at least a BSc in Biomedical Engineering, Electric Engineering, Computer science or similar health science engineering degree.
Strong knowledge of physiology of biological systems such as heart, lungs, and brain etc.
Proficiency in DSP, Data Science Pattern recognition, and ML/DL for DSP.
Strong programming skills in Python/MATLAB and object-oriented programming.
Experience in Embedded C (Optional)
Quick and Independent learner, not afraid of taking initiatives.
Passion for delivering solutions in the healthcare sector.
Familiar with the regulations and standards implications for the documentation of a medical device.


What We Offer


Join a team of passionate individuals and make a real impact on our business.
Flexible working hours to make the most of your time.
Hybrid work opportunities, allowing you to perform at your best.
We value eagerness to learn and positive energy, so apply even if you meet only some of the criteria.
Expect responsibility, challenges, professional and personal growth, and 24/7 office space availability.
Enjoy social events and receive a letter of recommendation.


For more information, please contact us and to apply, please send us an application via The Hub. Join IMP and be part of our mission to enhance patient quality of life, streamline supervision and monitoring, and empower health-related decision-making in the healthcare sector.
Show more

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist Position at Personalized Medicine Company
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
(Senior) Data Scientist Position at Personalized Medicine Company




GLX Analytix is revolutionizing personalized medicine through our groundbreaking GLX Signature Platform, combining innovative vascular biology with AI technology. As a clinical-stage, Silicon Valley-backed company, we're transforming care for patients with neurodegenerative, autoimmune, cardiovascular, and neuropsychiatric diseases.




If these topics inspire and activate your entrepreneur spirit, please apply for this position!




Position Overview We're seeking an exceptional Data Scientist with a strong base in statistics to join our Copenhagen team. You'll work with our modern data stack (Snowflake, dbt, terraform) to scale our biomarker platform from research to production. The ideal candidate combines strong statistical expertise with hands-on engineering capabilities and thrives in a dynamic environment where versatility is key. This role requires proficiency in SQL and Python, plus the adaptability and enthusiasm to tackle diverse technical challenges as we expand our diagnostic platform.




Your Impact - First 3 Months

·      Master our professional data stack (Snowflake, dbt cloud, terraform)

·      Contribute to our automated CI/CD pipelines using GitHub actions

·      Integrate with our MLOps infrastructure (ClearML)

·      Process and analyze critical datasets with our international team

·      Support key company decisions through data-driven insights




Your Impact - First Year

·      Scale our data platform as the company grows

·      Lead preparation of diagnostic tests for regulatory filing

·      Expand our real-world data program

·      Enhance biomarker discovery initiatives

·      Support US market expansion




Your Team

·      Direct teamwork with our data scientist in Copenhagen

·      Strategic input from part-time senior advisor with extensive bioinformatics experience

·      Access to our Silicon Valley network for specialized expertise




Required Qualifications

·      PhD or MSc with 2-7 years of industry experience

·      Strong foundation in statistics and data engineering

·      Expertise in SQL and Python programming




Technical Skills

·      Proficiency in: Git, SQL, Python

·      Knowledge of: bash, R, MLOps

·      Expertise in building scalable data systems

·      Experience with small to medium-sized dataset constraints

·      Experience with Snowflake, dbt, terrafrom, ClearML, GitHub actions is a plus.




Ideal Candidate

·      Quality-focused and systematic approach

·      Strong project management abilities

·      Pro-active leadership capabilities

·      Passion for applying their skillset to medicine for the benefit of patients and society

·      Experience in biotech, pharma, and/or CRO industries

·      Comfortable as a "jack-of-all-trades" in technical environment

·      Brings joy and creativity to their work




Bonus Qualifications

·      Background in and/or passion for human biology, in particular neurological disease

·      Experience with biofluids analysis and biomarker discovery




Position Details

·      Ideal Start Date: April 1, 2024 (flexible)

·      Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

·      Type: Full-time with competitive compensation

·      Requirements: Valid Danish work permit and English fluency




About GLX Analytix

Award-winning, venture-backed personalized medicine company pioneering advanced glycobiology research and novel blood biomarkers. Partnerships with leading medical institutions in Europe and the United States. Focused on transforming early detection and treatment monitoring for conditions including Alzheimer's Disease, Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, and Major Depressive Disorder.

·      Updated transcripts

·      Letter of interest

·      Letters of recommendation (optional)

(Senior) Data Scientist Position at Personalized Medicine Company


GLX Analytix is revolutionizing personalized medicine through our groundbreaking GLX Signature Platform, combining innovative vascular biology with AI technology. As a clinical-stage, Silicon Valley-backed company, we're transforming care for patients with neurodegenerative, autoimmune, cardiovascular, and neuropsychiatric diseases.


If these topics inspire and activate your entrepreneur spirit, please apply for this position!


Position Overview We're seeking an exceptional Data Scientist with a strong base in statistics to join our Copenhagen team. You'll work with our modern data stack (Snowflake, dbt, terraform) to scale our biomarker platform from research to production. The ideal candidate combines strong statistical expertise with hands-on engineering capabilities and thrives in a dynamic environment where versatility is key. This role requires proficiency in SQL and Python, plus the adaptability and enthusiasm to tackle diverse technical challenges as we expand our diagnostic platform.


Your Impact - First 3 Months

·      Master our professional data stack (Snowflake, dbt cloud, terraform)

·      Contribute to our automated CI/CD pipelines using GitHub actions

·      Integrate with our MLOps infrastructure (ClearML)

·      Process and analyze critical datasets with our international team

·      Support key company decisions through data-driven insights


Your Impact - First Year

·      Scale our data platform as the company grows

·      Lead preparation of diagnostic tests for regulatory filing

·      Expand our real-world data program

·      Enhance biomarker discovery initiatives

·      Support US market expansion


Your Team

·      Direct teamwork with our data scientist in Copenhagen

·      Strategic input from part-time senior advisor with extensive bioinformatics experience

·      Access to our Silicon Valley network for specialized expertise


Required Qualifications

·      PhD or MSc with 2-7 years of industry experience

·      Strong foundation in statistics and data engineering

·      Expertise in SQL and Python programming


Technical Skills

·      Proficiency in: Git, SQL, Python

·      Knowledge of: bash, R, MLOps

·      Expertise in building scalable data systems

·      Experience with small to medium-sized dataset constraints

·      Experience with Snowflake, dbt, terrafrom, ClearML, GitHub actions is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Vipps MobilePay, we remove hassle, create dazzle, and make it very, very easy for users to send and receive money. Being the most loved brands in both Norway and Denmark (and climbing fast in Finland), we impact people’s everyday lives by delivering great user experiences to 11 million users and collectively 400,000 stores/web shops across the Nordics.

Through joining forces, we want to make cross-border payments just as easy as shopping across the web in the Nordics. Our primary focus now is to consolidate our customers and users onto one common Nordic platform. This will enable us to build even better and highly scalable solutions.







About the role:

Are you ready to dive into a sea of data and unlock its potential? Vipps invites you to be a key player in our dynamic team, where we are not just sitting on data—we are leveraging it to revolutionize online payments! Imagine using your expertise to navigate through vast amounts of data, crafting insightful segmentations, and making predictions that propel our online payment solutions to new heights. As a central figure in our quest for data utilization excellence, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our investment in online payment. Your contributions will not only set ambitious strategies but also drive us toward our goals in the Financial Crime Prevention.




You will also be an important resource for setting an ambitious strategy and goals for the area of anti-fraud and risk-scoring. Data scientists in this area leverage advanced analytics, machine learning, and data-driven insights to identify and mitigate these risks, ensuring secure transactions for millions of users and predict fraud within fraction of a second. This will enhance customer trust and confidence in the platform.




The position is placed in Team Risk Scoring and Modelling under Financial Crime Prevention - here you will work together with skilled data engineers and developers.

Required Qualifications:

Master/bachelor's degree in Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
2+ years of proven hands-on experience in developing Machine Learning models
Strong proficiency in Python.
Extensive knowledge of key Python packages for Data Science and Machine Learning, including Pandas, Sklearn, PyTorch, and TensorFlow
Experience working with Big Data solutions.
Solid understanding of ETL pipelines and data processing frameworks.
Strong knowledge of code versioning tool (Git).







Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with Data Engineering concepts and practices.
Experience in MLFlow for managing end-to-end machine learning projects.
Experience with Apache Spark and Databricks Platform.
Familiarity with Azure cloud platform.
Experience with anti-fraud is a big plus.







What we value:

At Vipps MobilePay we work in cross-functional teams, and we trust our teams to know what's best for Vipps MobilePay. We spend our time both looking at the bigger picture and getting our hands dirty with complex problems. We get a kick out of such a bustling and collaborative environment, and you should too.




Above all else, we let our values guide us:

Keep it simple: Simple solutions to complicated problems.
No worries: A worry-free work environment, failing fast and big to test and progress.
One team: Co-creation and being in it together.







Applying for this position is as simple as using our products, just click on the button below and get in touch.




About the company




We are one Nordic mobile wallet that was once two: Vipps, founded in Norway and MobilePay, which originated in Denmark. Both launched with a mission to deliver a service that made sending money as easy as sending a text.




Now our brands have come together as one Nordic mobile wallet for everyone – and one of the largest in Europe. We make it easy for our merchants and partners to dream big – even if their business is small. So, whether you want to open a food truck at a flea market, a dessert shop downtown or a branch of the country’s largest superstore, with Vipps MobilePay you can go wherever your business takes you.

Description:
Join us at the University of Copenhagen for a postdoc exploring nature-derived drug discovery with AI/ML, genomics, and structural biology. Contribute to the EU-funded Biodiversity2Drugs project, predicting protein-protein interactions across species! 🧬🤖

Title: Front-end Developer
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About The Role

Trackman is growing, and we’re seeking an experienced Front-end Developer to help build and maintain high-quality web applications. You’ll work with React, Next.js, TypeScript, and NodeJs - but more importantly, you’ll write clean, modular code that’s built to last. If you’re passionate about modern web development, staying current with emerging technologies, and collaborating with a diverse, forward-thinking team.

What We’re Looking For

You are:


An experienced front-end developer who goes beyond just “delivering features”—you look for opportunities to refine our codebase, processes, and architecture.
Proactive in exploring new front-end trends but adopt them based on real benefits and maintainability.
Comfortable working closely with designers, backend developers, and project owners to craft seamless user experiences.
Eager to share knowledge, support continuous improvement, and promote teamwork across the organization.


Your Responsibilities


Feature Development Implement, optimize, and maintain client-side features using React, Next.js, and TypeScript, ensuring an exceptional user experience.
Agile Collaboration Work within an Azure DevOps environment, participating in sprints, retrospectives, and regular communication to uphold a culture of shared ownership and continuous improvement.
Tooling & Processes Develop and enhance build tools, test automation, and code reviews to improve collaboration and streamline development workflows.
Cross-Functional Planning Partner with UI/UX designers, backend engineers, and project owners on backlog refinement and task estimation, ensuring alignment with product goals.
Clean Code Principles Write maintainable, modular code with a strong emphasis on reusability and separation of concerns.
Design System Contribution Contribute to our design system and component library for consistent user interfaces across multiple products.
Continuous Improvement Drive enhancements in our codebase, pipelines, and tooling to keep our tech stack efficient and scalable.


Requirements


Front-end Experience Proven track record with modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Vue) and strong proficiency in TypeScript.
JavaScript Fundamentals In-depth understanding of the DOM, asynchronous programming, and performance considerations in modern browsers.
GraphQL Expertise Experience consuming GraphQL APIs and structuring queries efficiently.
Node.js Familiarity Comfortable with Node.js for build tooling and server-side rendering.
Build Tools Hands-on experience with Vite, Webpack, and NPM/Yarn.
Architectural Insight Good grasp of software design principles and architectural patterns, aiming for code that’s both robust and adaptable.
Framework-Agnostic Mindset Focus on writing maintainable, future-proof code rather than relying too heavily on specific libraries.
Collaboration & Communication Strong teamwork skills, with a willingness to mentor peers, share knowledge, and maintain open channels of communication.


Join Us

If you’re excited to shape the future of front-end development at Trackman—where continuous learning, innovation, and quality code are top priorities—we’d love to hear from you! Send us your resume, GitHub profile, or anything else that showcases your passion and expertise.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud of working in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarter located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, Seoul and Tokyo. We employ more than 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where most hardware and software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At Trackman, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive, and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of the exceptional solution. This mix is what makes Trackman an inspiring company – for our customers and our colleagues.

Share our Passion!

Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application as soon as possible. The position is intended for our Hørsholm HQ, Danish language is not a requirement.

If you got what it takes, apply today and join a company with great technologies, passionate colleagues, and great opportunities to grow.

apply now

Title: Data Scientist (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you our new Data Scientist?




AudienceProject is looking for a Data Scientist for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

—




Are you an analyst at heart? And do you have an interest in data modeling and programming? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta, Google, Amazon, Netflix, Disney+ etc.




AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 100+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies, and publishers across Europe.




Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach and effect of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach and impact their audiences more effectively.




Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science Research team.




Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the world’s biggest brands.




What you will do




You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.




In the Data Science Research team, you will work with seven other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Tech department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.

Essential qualifications

You have a Master's degree or higher education in a numerically oriented education. Candidates with a social science background, specializing in statistics and data analysis, are also welcome to apply.
You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create business insights.
You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, including various regression analyses.
You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and machine learning models.
Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analyzing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioral data.
An ability to understand the business implications of data and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages customers.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.




What we offer




A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.




Competitive salary
Pension scheme and health insurance
Home internet paid
Central Copenhagen office
Hybrid work model
Daily breakfast
Lunch made by an on-site chef
Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
International environment
Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
Innovative and market-leading products and services
Exposure to a lot of data handling
Technically/commercially challenging tasks
Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry




Send us your application




If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.




If you have any questions about the position, please contact Jacob Daniel Kirstejn Hansen at jacobh@audienceproject.com.




We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so please don’t hesitate to send your application. Apply by filling out the application form on our website.




The deadline for applications is February 24th, 2025. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.




We look forward to receiving your application!






Show more

  • Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
  • Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry


Send us your application


If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.


If you have any questions about the position, please contact Jacob Daniel Kirstejn Hansen at jacobh@audienceproject.com.


We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so please don’t hesitate to send your application. Apply by filling out the application form on our website.


The deadline for applications is February 24th, 2025. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.


We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist to be part of our AI development team. You will lead and drive transformative projects focusing on Generative AI – and occasionally Computer Vision. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing advanced machine learning solutions to enhance various aspects of the manufacturing processes within the life science industry. The ideal candidate will bring a strong software background, an innovative mindset, and the ability to build robust ML solutions that make a tangible impact.

Expectations


Lead the design, development, and deployment of machine learning models with a particular emphasis on Generative AI.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including biologists, operators, technicians, and engineers, to understand project requirements and develop tailored solutions.
When needed, contribute to image processing tasks (e.g., object detection, classification), though the focus is on broader AI applications.
Stay curious and informed about the latest advancements in ML, Generative AI frameworks, and related technologies—integrating them into ongoing projects.
Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment


A positive mindset, embracing teamwork and sharing knowledge with other team members and colleagues.
Show more

Title: Research Scientist at Personalized Medicine Company
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Research Scientist Position at Personalized Medicine Startup




Lab Operations and Biomarker Assay Development




GLX Analytix is revolutionizing personalized medicine through our groundbreaking GLX Signature Platform, combining innovative vascular biology with AI technology. As a clinical-stage, Silicon Valley-backed company, we're transforming care for patients with neurodegenerative, autoimmune, cardiovascular, and neuropsychiatric diseases.




Position Overview We're seeking a passionate Research Scientist to join our laboratory team in Copenhagen. You'll play a vital role in advancing our liquid biopsy platform, working under the guidance of our Laboratory Manager to develop and validate novel biomarker assays.




Your Impact - First 3 Months

·      Master our standardized laboratory protocols for blood sample processing

·      Support high-throughput immunoassay operations

·      Assist in validation studies for analytical and clinical performance

·      Document procedures and results according to regulatory standards

·      Contribute to laboratory automation initiatives




Your Impact - First Year

·      Preparation of GLX Signature Tests for regulatory filings

·      Support scaling of sample processing operations

·      Contribute to biomarker-discovery initiatives

·      Develop and optimize new analytical methods

·      Support US market expansion




Laboratory Focus

·      Processing large volumes of blood samples with precision

·      Executing complex immunoassay protocols (ELISA, Luminex, MSD)

·      Performing protein and glycan-based antibody purification

·      Maintaining quality control systems

·      Supporting method validation studies

·      Collaborating with data science team on assay optimization




Required Qualifications

·      MSc or PhD in biomedicine, bioengineering, chemistry, or related field

·      1-5 years of industry experience (post-doctoral applicants welcome)

·      Strong foundation in laboratory techniques and documentation

·      Experience with immunoassay platforms and development of biomarker assays




Technical Skills

·      Proficiency in immunoassay techniques and assay development

·      Experience with: Luminex, MSD, ELISA, Simoa, and/or Cobas platforms

·      Knowledge of protein/glycan-based antibody purification and coupling chemistry

·      Understanding of quality control systems

·      Laboratory automation experience




Ideal Candidate

·      Enjoys and excels at hands-on laboratory work

·      Takes pride in precise bench work and manual laboratory techniques

·      Detail-oriented with strong documentation skills

·      Excellent team player with collaborative mindset

·      Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects

·      Strong commitment to laboratory safety and quality

·      Passion for translational research




Bonus Qualifications

·      Experience with glycan and/or antibody bioengineering

·      Background in glycobiology and/or neurodegenerative, autoimmune, or cardiovascular disease

·      Familiarity with laboratory automation systems

·      Experience with biofluids analysis

·      Quality Management Systems (QMS) laboratory experience




Position Details

·      Ideal Start Date: April 1, 2025 (flexible)

·      Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

·      Type: Full-time with competitive compensation

·      Requirements: Valid Danish work permit and English fluency

·      Reports to: Laboratory Manager and Principal Scientist




About GLX Analytix Award-winning, venture-backed personalized medicine company pioneering advanced glycobiology research and novel blood biomarkers. Partnerships with leading medical institutions in Europe and the United States. Focused on transforming early detection and treatment monitoring for conditions including Alzheimer's Disease, Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, and Major Depressive Disorder.




How to Apply Submit to info@glxanalytix.com or via LinkedIn Job Post:

·      CV

·      Updated transcripts

·      Letter of interest

·      Professional references

·      Letters of recommendation (optional)




Application Timeline Rolling review until position is filled.




Keywords: Bioengineering, Glycobiology, Immunoassays, Luminex, Antibody Purification, Mass Spectrometry, Laboratory Standardization, Automation, Regulatory Compliance




Follow us on Linkedin: glxanalytix




www.glxanalytix.com




Join us in our mission to transform patient care through innovative diagnostics. GLX Analytix offers significant opportunities for professional growth and the chance to make a real impact in personalized medicine.




Winner of Roche Future of Healthcare Startup Award




"...this approach has a clear potential to improve the lives of patients all over the world.”

-      Dr. Tim M. Jaeger, Global SVP of Provider Insights and Roche Information Solutions, Roche

 

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist in Super AI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you an experienced IRB model developer who is looking for a new opportunity? Do you want to be part of shaping the future IRB model landscape in Danske Bank? Then come join our team of data scientists in the SuperAI department!

We are on a journey of fundamentally transforming our IRB model landscape to comply with recently implemented EBA guidelines and are looking for an expert to join us in developing best-in-class PD, LGD & EAD models for capital allocation, impairments, and internal steering.

You will join the IRB development team within the SuperAI department consisting of 80+ employees. Here, our aim is to build data science products to uncover and harness the value in our data and improve decision making at Danske Bank.

Our team oversees the entire model life cycle, from model design, to developing robust solutions in Python using best practices from software engineering to model implementation.


Depending on your experience, you may be offered a different seniority of the role.


You will:


Develop end-to-end data science solutions for PD, LGD, EAD models – from understanding the problem and designing the model, to deploying the final solution
Be a mentor for junior data scientists in the team, sharing your own knowledge and experience within data science, in general, and IRB modelling in particular
Communicate with non-technical stakeholders - distil complex concepts into a format that is easily understood, so that we can get the relevant business input to allow us to build representative and appropriate models
Participate in setting and documenting the standards and best practices for data science at Danske Bank


About you:


Deep knowledge of PD, LGD & EAD modelling through hands-on development and implementation of industry standard models in your previous workplace(s)/ including newly implemented EBA guidelines
Solid background in the mathematics underpinning data science and machine learning methodologies, as well as experience of implementing and deploying models using software engineering best practices
Experienced Python programmer (or similar OOP language)
Solid data science skills, especially within machine learning techniques applicable to IRB, storytelling through data and deployment of models to a production environment (version control, CI/CD tools, model performance tracking, etc.)
Good communication skills
Self-driven and collaborative mindset with the capability of thinking out-of-the-box
Upper-Intermediate English skills


Don't meet every single requirement? At Danske Bank we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you are interested in this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway.

“Everyone is welcome – bring your authentic and full self to work.”

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If the position is located in Lithuania the monthly salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package (benefits are only valid for Lithuania the same as the salary ranges) which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Kotryna Paulauskiene via LinkedIn, and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Motiveres du af at have en alsidig og spændende arbejdsgang, hvor du kan fordybe dig i Python kodning og implementering af machine learning modeller og mange andre spændende arbejdsopgaver, som du selv kan være med til at præge? Så kom og bring dine kompetencer i spil som vores nye Machine Learning Engineer til Vertica i Aarhus!




”Verti-hvem?”

Måske du har hørt om os? Måske ikke? Uanset hvad får du en lille intro her.

Hos Vertica bygger vi ecommerce. Det har vi gjort i mere end 20 år, og vi gør det sammen med nogle af landets førende virksomheder. Blandt vores kunder finder du Hørkram, Søstrene Grene, Molslinjen, Kvadrat, Brødrene Dahl og mange andre. Fælles for dem er, at de har et stort fokus på den brugerflade, som kunden møder, og det er her, vi hos Vertica kommer ind i billedet. For et års tid siden bredte vi vores ekspertise yderligere ud og startede vores AI og Data team, som arbejder på at hjælpe vores kunder med optimeringer ved hjælpe af AI og data drevne løsninger.




Du vil blive en del af vores nyetablerede AI og Data team, som består af kollegaer med forskellige baggrunde, hvor det som binder jer sammen, er jeres store interesse og faglighed indenfor data, AI og forretningsudvikling. Sammen sikrer I, hvordan I kan hjælpe vores kunder med at omsætte data til vigtige indsigter, som kan være med til at flytte og styrke deres forretning.




Da du er den første i denne specifikke rolle, vil du derfor have rig mulighed for sætte dit præg på, hvordan rollen skal udvikle sig, samt være med til at definere dine arbejdsopgaver. Men herunder er vores bud på, hvad du vil bruge en stor del af din tid på.




Dine opgaver bliver blandt andet:

Designe, bygge og levere værdiskabende ai-løsninger til en bred række af kunder i samarbejde med resten af AI og Data teamet.
Implementering af machine learning modeller: Samarbejde med vores Data Scientist for at bringe maskinlæringsmodeller fra udvikling til produktion samt sikre høj kvalitet, skalerbarhed og en stabil deployment-proces
Designe og implementerer MLOps workflows til at sikre en effektiv overgang fra Proof of Concept (poc) til produktion
Opsætte systemer til modelmonitorering, som muliggør løbende overvågning af modeller i produktion
Være med til at finde de bedste løsninger baseret på kundernes ønsker og behov




Vi forestiller os, at du har nedenstående kvalifikationer, men lige så̊ vigtigt er det, at du har lyst til at udvikle dig sammen med os og drive vores forretning mod nye højder




Vi søger dig, som har minimum 3 års relevant erhvervserfaring samt har et solidt teknisk grundlag og evnerne og forståelsen for at drive processer fra start til slut. Det er et plus, hvis du har erfaring med hele machine learning lifecycle.




Du har erfaring som konsulent og motiveres af at arbejde med AI projekter samt hjælpe kunder med at finde den bedste løsning til deres udfordringer




Du har erfaring med at sætte machine learning modeller i produktion
Du har stærke færdigheder og god erfaring med Python
Du har erfaring med MLOps (machine learning operations)
Du har flair og interesse for at arbejde med en bred vifte af AI løsninger herunder både generativ AI og klassiske machine learning løsninger




Det får du med i købet

Vi er jo et ecommerce-hus, så vi kan ikke dy os fra at smide lidt ekstra godter ned i din kurv:




0 chefer, 150 kollegaer. Her er der ingen, der bestemmer, hvordan du skal arbejde. Vi har sat beslutningerne fri, så dem der har faglighed og kompetence selv bestemmer, hvordan de løser opgaverne. Det betyder, at du og dit team får mulighed for at indrette jeres arbejde, sådan som I mener, det er bedst.




Gennemsigtighed er en af kerneværdierne i Vertica, og derfor ligger vores personalehåndbog frit tilgængeligt her. I personalehåndbogen kan du læse, hvilke vilkår vi - og alle vores fremtidige kolleger - arbejder under. Hvis ikke du har tid til at læse hele håndbogen igennem, så har vi fremhævet nogle af dem, vi sætter særligt pris på.




Livslang læring: Vi går i livets skole, men af og til er der også kurser, konferencer eller uddannelser, som man kan lære af. Er der noget, du gerne vil blive klogere på, har du muligheden for at videreuddanne dig i Vertica. Vi har intet loft på uddannelsesbudgettet, så der heller ikke er loft på læringen.




Det sociale: Vi holder af sociale arrangementer, og vi holder mange af dem. Det kan være alt fra klatring, padeltennis, byg-dit-eget-tastatur og cocktail-kursus til familietur i Djurs Sommerland. Derudover tager vi hvert år på en firmaweekend, hvor vi har fokus på hygge, god mad og socialt samvær.




Hele mennesker på arbejde: Vi tror på at der er andet i livet end arbejde og derfor er det vigtigt for os, at vi holder os inden for en 37-timers arbejdsuge, og at vi behandler hinanden med stor ordentlighed og respekt




Kan du se dig selv som en del af Vertica?

Lyder dette som dit næste skridt i din karriere? Så send din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt. Vi er klar over, at det er umuligt at give et fuldstændigt og retvisende billede af dig selv ud fra en ansøgning og CV alene, men indledningsvist er det desværre alt, vi har. Vi vil gerne lære personen bag ansøgningen så godt at kende som muligt. Fortæl os derfor om din passion og dine værdier. Hvis du vil høre mere om stillingen, så skriv eller ring til Sara Stefansen på sst@vertica.dk eller +45 22 15 44 06

Show more

  • Du har flair og interesse for at arbejde med en bred vifte af AI løsninger herunder både generativ AI og klassiske machine learning løsninger


Det får du med i købet

Vi er jo et ecommerce-hus, så vi kan ikke dy os fra at smide lidt ekstra godter ned i din kurv:


0 chefer, 150 kollegaer. Her er der ingen, der bestemmer, hvordan du skal arbejde. Vi har sat beslutningerne fri, så dem der har faglighed og kompetence selv bestemmer, hvordan de løser opgaverne. Det betyder, at du og dit team får mulighed for at indrette jeres arbejde, sådan som I mener, det er bedst.


Gennemsigtighed er en af kerneværdierne i Vertica, og derfor ligger vores personalehåndbog frit tilgængeligt her. I personalehåndbogen kan du læse, hvilke vilkår vi - og alle vores fremtidige kolleger - arbejder under. Hvis ikke du har tid til at læse hele håndbogen igennem, så har vi fremhævet nogle af dem, vi sætter særligt pris på.


Livslang læring: Vi går i livets skole, men af og til er der også kurser, konferencer eller uddannelser, som man kan lære af. Er der noget, du gerne vil blive klogere på, har du muligheden for at videreuddanne dig i Vertica. Vi har intet loft på uddannelsesbudgettet, så der heller ikke er loft på læringen.


Det sociale: Vi holder af sociale arrangementer, og vi holder mange af dem. Det kan være alt fra klatring, padeltennis, byg-dit-eget-tastatur og cocktail-kursus til familietur i Djurs Sommerland. Derudover tager vi hvert år på en firmaweekend, hvor vi har fokus på hygge, god mad og socialt samvær.


Hele mennesker på arbejde: Vi tror på at der er andet i livet end arbejde og derfor er det vigtigt for os, at vi holder os inden for en 37-timers arbejdsuge, og at vi behandler hinanden med stor ordentlighed og respekt


Kan du se dig selv som en del af Vertica?

Lyder dette som dit næste skridt i din karriere? Så send din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt. Vi er klar over, at det er umuligt at give et fuldstændigt og retvisende billede af dig selv ud fra en ansøgning og CV alene, men indledningsvist er det desværre alt, vi har. Vi vil gerne lære personen bag ansøgningen så godt at kende som muligt. Fortæl os derfor om din passion og dine værdier. Hvis du vil høre mere om stillingen, så skriv eller ring til Sara Stefansen på sst@vertica.dk eller +45 22 15 44 06

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your Role In Our Mission

We are looking for an AI Engineer to help us take systems that understand large technical documents and turn them into code. This is a job of excitement and exploration, requiring AI expertise and software engineering skills to build complex systems. Knowledge of semiconductors is a plus.

At Normal Computing, you will contribute to cutting-edge machine learning applications across various aspects of our business, working on solutions from the early stages of research and development to production deployment for our customers.

Responsibilities


Contribute to AI projects from concept to production deployment
Design and build systems using large language models to process complex technical documents
Develop solutions for multi-modal data handling (PDFs, logs, tables)
Solve challenging AI and software engineering problems
Work with other teams to integrate AI into our products
Create robust AI evaluation frameworks
Develop strategies to manage AI-specific challenges (latency, variance, errors)
Keep up with AI advancements, especially in language models and multi-modal AI


What Makes You A Great Fit


Experience with engineering projects, ideally related to ML or AI
Strong software engineering skills, especially with distributed systems
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (PyTorch, Hugging Face)
Experience with prompt engineering and deploying language models
Ability to handle and preprocess large, diverse datasets
Understanding of AI safety and responsible development
Knowledge of AI evaluation and benchmarking
Clear communication of complex AI concepts


Bonus Points For


Experience deploying AI in production environments
Cloud platform knowledge for AI deployment
Familiarity with advanced AI techniques (few-shot learning, meta-learning)
Open-source AI contributions or relevant publications
Ability to balance AI innovation with production-ready systems
Adaptability in a fast-paced, evolving AI landscape


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Normal Computing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Accessibility Accommodations

Normal Computing is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know at accomodations@normalcomputing.ai.

Privacy Notice

By submitting your application, you agree that Normal Computing may collect, use, and store your personal information for employment-related purposes in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Microsoft Azure AI Studio
AutoGen
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Pension plan contributions
Private health & life insurance
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).


Show more
