Title: Applied Research Scientist - Digital Enterprise Transformation
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Req Number: 89881

Time Type: Full Time

Do you want to push the boundaries of machine learning and scale it to users across the world? Do you wish for a product centric work environment, where machine learning and analytics drive action – not just insight?

With a strong focus on the applied machine learning research discipline, you will take part in innovation and design of new products, as well as tweak and mature existing ones. You will join a team of highly talented data scientists and collaborate with several product teams consisting of product owners, backend- and frontend developers and DevSecOps specialists. You will be pushing the applied research agenda, aiming to create and continuously innovate the ML systems of tomorrow.

Join a department focused on our most valuable digital products

You will join the Research and AI Lab team in the Digital Enterprise Transformation department. Our new Research and AI Lab unit is characterized by having an intrapreneurial mindset, and is collaborating holistically with established MLOps, DevSecOps and

Data Science teams that have had ML systems in production on a global scale for several years. We strive to base our work on knowledge and insight rather than hierarchical structures, and we make sure that our decisions are based on conversations between people with different competencies rather than one individual.

Examples of what we have worked on in 2024:



Trained, tuned, and served large generative language models for document processing and for conversation using both text and multimodal data.
Designed a new large machine learning system set for release in early 2025.
Implemented and deployed an ‘attention-free’ transformer model, including functionality for large-scale model training and inference.



Current plans set for 2025:



Establish an industrial research presence, including publishing our work in relevant ML journals/conferences and collaboration with academic research institutions.
Become creators rather than consumers in GenAI and multimodal machine learning.
And more!



You thrive when solving highly complex challenges

The use cases we handle tend to have a high degree of complexity, requiring non-deterministic problem solving (i.e., the use of ML/AI), near real-time data processing, a need for high availability, vertical and horizontal scalability, and a very high volume of transactions. Solving complex problems with the use of machine learning, you need an open and analytical mind, finding pragmatic solutions that balance between the theoretical standpoint and what is possible .

Be the driver of our AI/ML and GenAI journey

As our Applied Research Scientist, your work will be multifaceted. We will work on our research agenda and push for new machine learning applications and methods, while ensuring this work is well-adopted by the existing teams for use in downstream products that will directly impact DSV’s divisions. You will have a mix of independent work and participate in existing project-focused teams.

Responsibilities:



Advance GenAI and multimodal research and development: Spearhead applied research in GenAI and multimodal machine learning, encompassing image, layout, and text/language modeling.
Drive applied research that can be applied to DSV’s product development. Drive cross-project innovation to tackle complex challenges and real-world problems to gain new insights and apply findings to enhance model performance and outcomes.
Foundational model development: Independently architect, train, and evaluate foundational models to advance GenAI LLMs and multimodal systems in DSV’s field of work.



Skills and experience we value and would love you to have already:



Educational Background: Preferably a PhD or master's degree in CS, CE, ML or a related field, with proven research experience.
Strong Theoretical Foundation: A comprehensive skill set in mathematics, statistics, and algorithms is essential for implementing research ideas, building upon existing research to create new, and adapting established work to our domain.
Software Development: A good understanding of core programming and development concepts: data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming. You will both be performing rapid prototyping and contribute to large collaborative machine learning codebases. We primarily use Python due to the high availability of machine learning frameworks.
Publications and Open-Source Contributions: Proven track record of first-author peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate your ability to lead research projects and navigate the publication process, along with contributions to open-source projects.
Model Development and Architecture: Proficiency in building from scratch, modifying and optimizing existing models and in advanced model architectures, particularly for GenAI and multimodal applications .
Accelerated and Distributed Compute: Proficiency in accelerated parallel computing, including scalable data processing and leveraging of GPU technology for enhanced performance and model training scalability. We use frameworks such as: PyTorch, Kedro, Apache Beam, and more.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and applying new academic insights to solve complex business challenges.
Practical Experience: Hands-on experience with large-scale, real-world machine learning projects.
Self-Starter & Ownership: We're looking for someone who is proactive, takes initiative, and can drive projects independently. You should be comfortable taking ownership of objectives and pushing things forward.



We understand that no candidate may meet every single requirement listed here. If you meet some of the qualifications, but not all, we still encourage you to apply! We're looking for passionate individuals who are eager to grow and contribute to our team.

What we offer to you:



Direct Communication: We engage directly with VP and C-level stakeholders, ensuring your insights and contributions are heard at the highest levels.
Influence on MLOps: Play a key role in shaping our mature, in-house MLOps platform, working with a dynamic and growing team.
Global Scale Experience: Leverage our extensive experience with ML systems in production on a global scale, benefiting from our experience in development and operations processes for large-scale machine learning systems.
A proven team: A group which is already self-financed based on realized returns of machine learning business cases.
Research and AI Lab: Be part of our new Research and AI Lab initiative, where you can influence methodologies, the direction, and the research agenda.



If you want to apply

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call Ramus Kær Jørgensen on +45 25452587.

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.
Show more

Title: MLOps Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Pandora is the World’s largest jewellery brand, known for affordable luxury, innovative design and our high-quality craftsmanship. Founded in 1982 in Copenhagen, Denmark, by Per Enevoldsen and his wife Winnie, Pandora started as a small jewelry shop and has since grown into the globally recognized brand it is today.

At Pandora, we are transforming the retail experience by leveraging our vast data combined with cutting-edge technology. Our mission is to provide an exceptional shopping experience to our customers by leveraging data-driven insights and innovative solutions across our business. We are looking for a talented MLOps Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us shape the future of retail.

Job Summary:

As an MLOps Engineer at Pandora, you will play a play a critical role in deploying, monitoring, and optimizing machine learning models in production environments. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between our AI Team and our Data Platform engineers, ensuring the seamless integration of ML models into scalable and reliable systems. In this role you will design and implement robust MLOps pipelines, automate model training and deployment processes, and monitor the performance of ML systems, including systems for GenAI. Your expertise in cloud platforms, containerization, and CI/CD tools will drive the operational efficiency of our AI and machine learning initiatives. We encourage creative problem-solving, continuous learning, and work-life balance in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop and maintain end-to-end MLOps pipelines for model deployment, monitoring, maintenance, and scalability.
Automate the retraining, testing, and validation processes for ML models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data science, software engineering and DevOps, to integrate ML models into production systems.
Monitor model performance, diagnose issues, and implement improvements.
Ensure scalability, reliability, and compliance of ML systems in production.
Optimize infrastructure costs while maintaining high system performance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in MLOps, machine learning and AI, and apply new techniques to improve existing models and processes.



Qualifications:


Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience:
Solid experience as a MLOps Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or similar role.
Experience in the retail industry or e-commerce is highly desirable.
Technical Skills:
Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code frameworks and languages (Terraform, Bicep or ARM)
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Hands-on experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration tools (Kubernetes).
Proficiency in CI/CD tools and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).
Knowledge of model monitoring and evaluation metrics.
Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git, and model versioning tools like MLflow or DVC.
Experience with Generative AI product deployment is desirable.
Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop is desirable.
System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.

Our Pandora Values:

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Stress Testing the Credit Portfolio Losses
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Join our collaborative team driving the Stress test calculations on loan losses at Danske Bank. We are responsible for maintaining and operating a suite of models utilized by several departments across the bank.

A key aspect of the role is the ability to aggregate and present model outputs in a clear and understandable manner. Our team also supports the strategic risk steering of the bank through quantitative analysis, including setting risk tolerance levels to protect the bank against severe losses and conducting ‘what if’ analyses such as scenarios involving the return of inflation, increasing interest rates, and decreasing house prices.

You will join a friendly team of eight data scientists with diverse quantitative backgrounds. Half of the team is based in Copenhagen, while the other half works from Vilnius..

"Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different seniority of the role.

You will:


Co-own the continuous development and optimization of the bank’s stress test models in Python
Engage with stakeholders and continuously improve the understanding and presentation of model outputs
Deliver input to the dialogue with the bank's auditors, model validators, external audit, and regulatory authorities


The tasks of the team are varied and model-centric, and we value the diverse skills each team member brings. If you are passionate about data science and are ready to embark on your career with us, we encourage you to apply.

About you:


Proficiency in Python
Experience in presenting and visualizing complex data to stakeholders
Experience in working with Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud-based setups
A solid quantitative background
Proactive mindset with great collaboration and communication skills
Analytical skills with the ability to communicate technical information in a non-technical and concise manner
Banking experience is welcome but not essential; however, a genuine interest in exploring the fascinating world of banking is expected
Experience in building and operating models is highly valued


“We invite candidates with a degree in a quantitative field to apply, even if you do not meet every skill listed. Your enthusiasm and potential could be exactly what we need.”

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 to 4920 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant for the job)

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; III rd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

Feel free to contact me @LinkedIn if you have any questions! Lars Thejls Aagaard, Head of Portfolio Intelligence, FVP at Danske Bank

#LT

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Asset Reliability-Data Scientist
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll get the opportunity to be part of a diverse and interdisciplinary engineering team responsible for driving the reliability, availability & maintainability of our assets. As a data scientist, you’ll gain broad exposure to our operations in UK West and be involved in a variety of projects that require deep understanding of asset performance & measurement data and tools. Primarily, you'll help us optimize the performance & maintenance of our assets by co-developing (with our central condition monitoring teams and internal technical optimization team) models to monitor & predict faults on our offshore asset by co-developing (with our central condition monitoring teams and internal technical optimization team) models to monitor & predict faults on our offshore assets, utilizing vast quantities of data from sensors, SAP, SCADA and other sources (ex. Logistics, price, weather etc.) to tell compelling stories and move the needle on asset performance.

Welcome to Engineering - UK West

You’ll be part of Reliability & Maintenance team where you, together with your colleagues, will deliver on our Engineering strategy to ensure that performance & maintenance is data-driven and proactive. The Reliability & Maintenance team primarily focuses on ensuring methodical, data driven and proactive Reliability, Availability & Maintenance (in particular through Reliability Centered Maintenance practices) of our assets. The team consists of engineering Subject Matter Experts, Technical Optimization experts (ensuring data driven decision making) and Quality & Risk experts. Most condition monitoring models today come from our central teams and are built to inform our wind farms of faults before they cause downtime. Our aim is to strengthen the Diagnostic capability within our region of UKW as an end-to-end team to develop deep knowledge of our assets based on multiple data sources, maintenance strategies coupled with faster action-oriented processes flow. As a team, we pride ourselves in having a fun, collaborative, and inclusive culture. We collaborate with subject matter experts across the company and work closely together to ensure quality delivery.

You’ll play an important role in:


analysing and evaluating asset sensor data, SCADA data, SAP data & data from other operational applications and commercial data to identify and troubleshoot technical issues affecting asset performance
translating these complex technical findings into running models and/or reports which alert our sites and ensure that faults are investigated and rectified by our technicians
statistical analysis and investigations towards developing, testing, and updating Key Performance Indicators
developing, testing, and implementing advanced diagnostic algorithms that provide accurate diagnosis and prognosis of faults
driving the technical performance capabilities towards fully utilizing centrally- developed tools and systems to have the highest performance impact, while acting as a translator between technical specialists and central developers
setting requirements towards central development teams for operational systems and developments to fully support the business requirements.


To succeed in the role, you:


have a statistical and logic-focused mindset with experience within performance measurements or analysis and reporting
have an MSc or BSc degree in engineering, data science, physics, mathematics, or another relevant discipline involving data analytics
have high proficiency in critical analysis and problem resolution, are equipped to handle voluminous data, develop simulation models based on technical and commercial input, conduct statistical enquiries, and establish well-founded and reproducible answers to convoluted questions
are confident and experienced working with with Python in a professional setting (such as familiarity with version control, Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, Docker, SQL, etc.) and PowerBI. SAP FIORI experience will be highly preferred
must have knowledge of wind turbine operations, or are excited to learn more about mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and general maintenance engineering
must have experience in both data science & data engineering.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Performance Management and Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist, you will enhance predictive analytics, build automation and drive impactful improvements across the organisation.

Data Scientist specialising in process performance
As a Data Scientist specialising in process performance, you will enhance and automate predictive performance models. You will unlock new potential through AI and machine learning to predict outcomes while ensuring the consistent use of standardised data, methods and measures across the organisation. Additionally, you will support and validate critical KPIs.

Systematic is rated at CMMI Maturity Level 5, a distinction held by only a few companies worldwide. Your work will help maintain this high maturity level through clear and impactful process performance reporting combined with effective measurement of our improvement initiatives.

This is a newly established role, created as part of our ambition to elevate our performance management capability to the next level!

In this role, you will collaborate with teams across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights, ensuring that our processes are optimised and consistent and aligned with business goals. Your key responsibilities include:


Developing and validating process-performance models:
Gathering and validating data to build reliable models that reflect business needs.
Automating and improving reporting:
Enhancing quarterly process-performance baseline reporting and contributing to the Wall of Fame initiative.
Supporting master data quality.
Analysing data to provide the insights needed for precise and quantitative decisions.
Automating and improving prediction through the use of statistical techniques, machine learning and/or AI.
Participating in CMMI Appraisals.



The team
You will be part of a small, dedicated team of highly skilled specialists. Organised within the Finance department, the team collaborates closely with our internal Business Intelligence team and our Business Process Management team. Most importantly, it works across the organisation to support our programme managers in achieving process performance objectives. The team’s mission is to ensure, maintain and enhance a high level of maturity throughout Systematic.

Driven by automation and predictive analysis
We are looking for an experienced and driven candidate with a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree who is passionate about automation and predictive analysis.

You thrive on working with data, statistics and numbers, and your structured approach ensures high-quality results.
At the same time, you have the curiosity and creativity to think outside the box and find innovative solutions.
We expect you to have several years of experience with R, VBA, robotics or similar, and the ability to leverage these technologies to drive automations.
You are proactive, motivated to push things forward and you enjoy working at the intersection of data, technology and business optimisation.



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. Systematic is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which organises almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Bettina Damm, Senior Specialist.

Get in touch

Sofie Heiner Emborg

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Software Engineer Data Scientist
Place: Rom By, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
CHE COSA CERCHIAMO

Rheinmetall Italia S.p.A sta cercando un/una Software Engineer Data Scientist da inserire all’interno dell'unità Sviluppo Software, per la propria sede di Roma.

Siamo leader mondiale nella Difesa e Sicurezza, operiamo in oltre 60 paesi come parte di uno dei principali gruppi industriali europei, Rheinmetall AG e siamo l’unica azienda nel settore della Difesa nel novero dei 40 titoli tedeschi a maggiore capitalizzazione e liquidità quotati sul segmento “Prime Standard” della Borsa di Francoforte (Dax 40).

Siamo un'azienda che sta affrontando un processo di evoluzione e trasformazione digitale in grado di creare opportunità di carriera in un ambiente di apprendimento e sviluppo continuo.

Etica, integrità, sostenibilità, inclusione, customer-centricity e innovazione sono i nostri valori da cui discende l'impegno per le nostre persone.

Sei una persona innovativa che ricerca il miglioramento continuo in tutto quello che fa?

Ti piace lavorare in team per migliorare i processi e le prestazioni della funzione in cui lavori?

Vuoi avere un ruolo attivo, che ti venga riconosciuto, nella crescita aziendale?

Vuoi lavorare con i migliori tecnici e/o ingegneri presenti nel mercato della difesa?

Vuoi acquisire nuove competenze e soft skills?

In qualità di Software Engineer Data Scientist sarai inserito/a in un team rivolto alla ricerca dell’eccellenza, e sarai coinvolto/a nello sviluppo e nell’implementazione di soluzioni AI e di analisi avanzata dei dati, che assumono un ruolo strategico e mission-critical in una molteplicità di contesti. Lavorerai a stretto contatto con ingegneri e altri professionisti del settore, all’interno di team multidisciplinari, seguendo le pratiche Agile per la progettazione e realizzazione di modelli e pipeline di data processing.

Il Software Engineer nella funzione di Data Scientistsarà responsabile della raccolta, elaborazione e modellazione dei dati, nonché dell’implementazione di soluzioni di Machine Learning/Deep Learning di alta qualità, garantendone la validazione e la manutenzione. Collabora con il team, documenta il lavoro per assicurare la consegna di prodotti e analisi efficienti e funzionali, infine apprende costantemente nuove pratiche, framework e algoritmi di Intelligenza Artificiale.

La posizione prevede la progettazione e l’implementazione di modelli predittivi, di pipeline di elaborazione dati robuste, di alta qualità, che assicurino affidabilità, efficienza, sicurezza e manutenibilità. Verrà curato l’intero ciclo di vita dei progetti di AI: dall’analisi dei requisiti e della qualità dei dati, attraverso la definizione dei modelli e la loro validazione, fino all’integrazione su infrastrutture di calcolo on-premise o cloud.

Le tue principali attività saranno:



Analisi dei requisiti di sistema e studi di fattibilità;
Sviluppo e progettazione di applicativi di Data Science e non solo;
Realizzazione di pipeline dati (ETL/ELT), scripting e automazione di processi di data cleaning e feature engineering;
Redazione della documentazione tecnica in conformità agli standard aziendali e alle best practices;
Progettazione di suite di test per la validazione di modelli di Machine Learning/Deep Learning;
Ottimizzazione delle prestazioni, tuning degli algoritmi e delle pipeline di elaborazione dati, utilizzo di profiler e tool di analisi di performance;
Utilizzo di tools di gestione del ciclo di vita del software e di Continuos Integration/Delivery;
Garantire la qualità dei prodotti secondo gli standard aziendali.



CHE COSA DEVI PORTARE CON TE

Valutiamo con interesse:



Laurea Magistrale in Informatica o Ing. Informatica con focus su Intelligenza Artificiale;
Buona conoscenza della Iingua inglese parlata e scritta (livello B2);
Ottima conoscenza dei principali standard di analisi e progettazione del software O.O;
Ottima conoscenza di tutto il ciclo di vita del software e dei progetti di AI;
Ottima conoscenza di Python, Java e/o C++;
Ottima conoscenza dei framework/librerie TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, LangChain;
Ottima conoscenza dei DB sia SQL che NoSQL;
Buona conoscenza dei principali strumenti di analisi dei dati: Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib;
Buona conoscenza dei principi di TDD e Unit Testing per il test e la validazione del software prodotto;
Buone capacità di ottimizzazione del software attraverso l'uso di profiler e tools per l'analisi del codice statica e dinamica.



CHE COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Cosa offriamo:



Ambiente internazionale e caratterizzato da sfide e dinamicità
Opportunità di sviluppo professionale
Programmi di alta formazione
Un contesto lavorativo inclusivo, che abbraccia e valorizza l'unicità in tutte le sue forme
Retribuzione in linea con i maggiori players, proporzionata alle competenze e alla seniority possedute, che sarà compresa fra i 35k e i 40k
Programmi di Welfare innovativi e costruiti intorno alle persone
Assicurazione sanitaria
Ristorante Aziendale
Parcheggio per i dipendenti
Servizio Concierge
Modello di lavoro ibrido
Flessibilità oraria



Valutiamo con estremo interesse le candidature appartenenti alle categorie protette ai sensi degli artt. 1 e 18, legge 68/99.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei DL 215/03 e 216/03.

Le persone sono il nostro ASSET aziendale e rappresentano un patrimonio imprescindibile per l’innovazione del nostro business. I continui cambiamenti tecnologici e le trasformazioni del mercato richiedono flessibilità di pensiero, apprendimento rapido e mobilità. Invece della standardizzazione di massa, noi abbracciamo l'unicità di massa e la centricità umana.

This announcement is addressed to both sexes, in accordance with Laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and nationalities, in accordance with DL 215/03 and 216/03.

We undertake to evaluate candidates belonging to the protected categories pursuant to art. 1 and 18, law 68/99.

PER INFORMAZIONI



migliarini@rheinmetall.it
Show more
HTML:
CHE COSA CERCHIAMO

Rheinmetall Italia S.p.A sta cercando un/una Software Engineer Data Scientist da inserire all’interno dell'unità Sviluppo Software, per la propria sede di Roma.

Siamo leader mondiale nella Difesa e Sicurezza, operiamo in oltre 60 paesi come parte di uno dei principali gruppi industriali europei, Rheinmetall AG e siamo l’unica azienda nel settore della Difesa nel novero dei 40 titoli tedeschi a maggiore capitalizzazione e liquidità quotati sul segmento “Prime Standard” della Borsa di Francoforte (Dax 40).

Siamo un'azienda che sta affrontando un processo di evoluzione e trasformazione digitale in grado di creare opportunità di carriera in un ambiente di apprendimento e sviluppo continuo.

Etica, integrità, sostenibilità, inclusione, customer-centricity e innovazione sono i nostri valori da cui discende l'impegno per le nostre persone.

Sei una persona innovativa che ricerca il miglioramento continuo in tutto quello che fa?

Ti piace lavorare in team per migliorare i processi e le prestazioni della funzione in cui lavori?

Vuoi avere un ruolo attivo, che ti venga riconosciuto, nella crescita aziendale?

Vuoi lavorare con i migliori tecnici e/o ingegneri presenti nel mercato della difesa?

Vuoi acquisire nuove competenze e soft skills?

In qualità di Software Engineer Data Scientist sarai inserito/a in un team rivolto alla ricerca dell’eccellenza, e sarai coinvolto/a nello sviluppo e nell’implementazione di soluzioni AI e di analisi avanzata dei dati, che assumono un ruolo strategico e mission-critical in una molteplicità di contesti. Lavorerai a stretto contatto con ingegneri e altri professionisti del settore, all’interno di team multidisciplinari, seguendo le pratiche Agile per la progettazione e realizzazione di modelli e pipeline di data processing.

Il Software Engineer nella funzione di Data Scientistsarà responsabile della raccolta, elaborazione e modellazione dei dati, nonché dell’implementazione di soluzioni di Machine Learning/Deep Learning di alta qualità, garantendone la validazione e la manutenzione. Collabora con il team, documenta il lavoro per assicurare la consegna di prodotti e analisi efficienti e funzionali, infine apprende costantemente nuove pratiche, framework e algoritmi di Intelligenza Artificiale.

La posizione prevede la progettazione e l’implementazione di modelli predittivi, di pipeline di elaborazione dati robuste, di alta qualità, che assicurino affidabilità, efficienza, sicurezza e manutenibilità. Verrà curato l’intero ciclo di vita dei progetti di AI: dall’analisi dei requisiti e della qualità dei dati, attraverso la definizione dei modelli e la loro validazione, fino all’integrazione su infrastrutture di calcolo on-premise o cloud.

Le tue principali attività saranno:


  • Analisi dei requisiti di sistema e studi di fattibilità;
  • Sviluppo e progettazione di applicativi di Data Science e non solo;
  • Realizzazione di pipeline dati (ETL/ELT), scripting e automazione di processi di data cleaning e feature engineering;
  • Redazione della documentazione tecnica in conformità agli standard aziendali e alle best practices;
  • Progettazione di suite di test per la validazione di modelli di Machine Learning/Deep Learning;
  • Ottimizzazione delle prestazioni, tuning degli algoritmi e delle pipeline di elaborazione dati, utilizzo di profiler e tool di analisi di performance;
  • Utilizzo di tools di gestione del ciclo di vita del software e di Continuos Integration/Delivery;
  • Garantire la qualità dei prodotti secondo gli standard aziendali.


CHE COSA DEVI PORTARE CON TE

Valutiamo con interesse:


  • Laurea Magistrale in Informatica o Ing. Informatica con focus su Intelligenza Artificiale;
  • Buona conoscenza della Iingua inglese parlata e scritta (livello B2);
  • Ottima conoscenza dei principali standard di analisi e progettazione del software O.O;
  • Ottima conoscenza di tutto il ciclo di vita del software e dei progetti di AI;
  • Ottima conoscenza di Python, Java e/o C++;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei framework/librerie TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, LangChain;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei DB sia SQL che NoSQL;
  • Buona conoscenza dei principali strumenti di analisi dei dati: Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib;
  • Buona conoscenza dei principi di TDD e Unit Testing per il test e la validazione del software prodotto;
  • Buone capacità di ottimizzazione del software attraverso l'uso di profiler e tools per l'analisi del codice statica e dinamica.

Title: MLOps Engineer with Python
Description:
We invite you to join a project for one of our clients, an international company, one of the biggest sports brands in the world.

We seek a highly skilled MLOps Engineer to build automation to enable machine learning engineers to continuously deliver predictive analytics for performance, forecasting, personalization, and inventory optimization. You will work with a team of architects, platform engineers, and machine learning engineers to come up with new and interesting models, test them, and productionalize and scale them in the cloud as APIs, stream processing, or massive batch processing. We are looking for a high-energy individual with experience developing cloud-native applications, APIs, and data pipelines that value automation, testing, and security. You will orchestrate cloud, containers, big data, parallel processing technologies, advanced analytics, machine learning, and deep learning techniques to quantitatively plan product demand, allocate resources, and target the right customers with the best products.




Your tasks

Create cloud infrastructure for machine learning following the MLOps model
Develop and implement public and internal APIs
Design event and streaming-based services
Build Tests and Build a Pipeline for automated Deployment
Establish Monitoring and Alerting for custom infrastructure
Worki with batch data pipelines for machine learning for massive data sets
Support investigation of new cloud services, software packages/tools, APIs, container management, and distributed systems, to continuously deliver quality analytics and machine learning at scale
Cooperate with a cross-functional agile team of software engineers, data engineers, ML experts, and others to build new product features
Enable rapid iteration and product quality through continuous A/B testing
Design, implement, and maintain solutions/platforms
Collaborate with platform engineering and architects to utilize best practices and maintain compliance




Requirements

At least 5 years of demonstrated experience in enabling MLOps
Experience with system configuration management tools, such as Ansible, Puppet, or Chef
Knowledge of CI/CD infrastructure using Git, Jenkins, or similar tools
Proficiency with Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, containers, and related tools and systems
Background with AWS components and services, particularly, IAM, ECS/EKS, EMR, S3, and Lambda/Serverless
Prefer infrastructure as code experience with CloudFormation or Terraform
Strong Python, shell scripting, and SQL
Familiarity with Spark, Databricks, Snowflake
Attention to agile development processes, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, software engineering, or related field preferred
Show more

Title: Nordic Full-Stack Data Scientist - L'Oréal Nordic - Copenhagen
Description:
A Day in the Life!

As the Nordic Full-Stack Data Scientist, you will be joining the CDMO Data Team, a centralized transformation driver supporting all business divisions and functions. Our mission is to propel the business towards the future of Data & Analytics, collaborating closely with Regional HQ & Global teams while serving as an agile business partner for local stakeholders. Your work will be directly linked to our business strategy, influencing how we interpret, plan, and execute client-centric initiatives.

In this dynamic role, flexibility and adaptability are key as we navigate and learn. Your core responsibilities will include:

Data Integration: Building seamless data flows between various internal and external sources.

Analytics Development: Developing datasets and analytical models to address specific business needs.

Insight Enhancement: Creating statistical, predictive, and gap-filling data models to enrich our understanding of our business & retailers.

Solution Design: Developing user-friendly front-end analytics solutions using PowerBI, enabling stakeholders to access and interpret data effectively.

Global Alignment: Implementing core Group analytics solutions in the Nordics, ensuring consistency and scalability within Group compliance.

Project Orchestration: Proactively managing projects and stakeholders, aligning with our roadmap to deliver impactful results.

Collaboration: Working closely with Global & Zone technical teams to ensure solutions are scalable and compliant with Group standards.

We Are Looking For

Technical Expertise: Proficiency in Google Cloud Platform (Cloud Functions & Cloud Projects), BigQuery, Azure (Functions & Logic Apps), SQL, Python, R, SFTP, APIs, PowerBI (DAX, Data modeling & Data visualization), and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, PowerApps).

Data-Driven Mindset: A passion for leveraging data to drive business decisions and a proven ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.

Collaborative Spirit: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to bridge the gap between business and technical stakeholders.

Proactive Approach: A self-starter with a proactive and innovative mindset enabling continuous progress.

Strategic Thinking: A solid understanding of our data strategy & framework, our business objectives activities and ability to scope solutions within.

Solution-Oriented: Ability to deliver sustainable and scalable solutions that meet long-term business needs.

We are looking for you to start as soon as we have found YOU. The employment is permanent. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so do not wait to apply. We welcome everyone to apply no matter your gender, ethnicity, physical abilities, religion, or sexual orientation.

What’s In It For You


A place for you to challenge yourself and grow beyond your potential (here, you’ll be encouraged to try new things!). Real responsibility from day 1, there’s no sitting on the sidelines at L’Oréal.
An environment where people of every ethnicity, social background, age, religion, gender, and sexual orientation as well as people with disabilities are accepted, can speak up, will thrive and are celebrated!
A place where you can contribute to something bigger! Many of our brands have societal /environmental causes to make concrete difference.


Who We Are

L’Oréal is present in 150 markets on five continents. For more than a century, L’Oréal has devoted itself solely to ‘Create beauty that moves the world’; it is now the industry world leader with €42 billion consolidated sales. Together, we solve complex challenges at scale, while making sure we stay committed to making the world a more inclusive and a better place for everyone & our planet.

Today, L’Oréal includes over 9k experts in beauty tech, digital, data and e-comm and is constantly growing. Championing Beauty Tech, we invent the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.

We’re committed to guaranteeing inclusive recruitment processes and to advocating for hiring and promoting each candidate in an ethical and equitable way. The Group strictly prohibits discrimination against any applicant for employment because of the individual’s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, visible and/or invisible disabilities, socio-economic and/or multicultural origins, health conditions, age, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law.
Show more

Title: Security Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
How You'll Support Our Mission

ESO's teams are growing, and our software is in demand globally by firefighters, paramedics, hospitals and governments. To meet this demand, we are building an industry-leading cyber security team in Belfast to protect our customers and data from a variety of fast moving and constantly evolving threats.

We are looking for Security Engineers to join our Copenhagen, Belfast and US teams. Work alongside our fire, hospital and EMS Engineering teams to secure our mission-critical applications. These applications are used to help our customers go about their daily job of protecting their communities and saving lives.

You will be helping to design and implement systems using techniques such as defence in depth, threat modelling and zero trust across Microsoft Azure cloud native technologies.

Our security engineers have a high degree of autonomy, and are part of a high functioning, motivated and forward-thinking team. You have the chance to join a diverse, growing and passionate team, working on critical products, whilst being supported with training opportunities and mentoring.

Joining our team will be an amazing and truly rewarding experience.

What You'll Be Doing – the day to day


Have significant impact on the security of our systems that are used by thousands of fire fighters, paramedics and hospitals worldwide.
Be a key part of our cyber security team, with demonstrable impact on the security of our systems and applications. 
Help our teams to model threats using the STRIDE model, against new designs, ensuring appropriate protection and controls are in place.
Make a difference by mitigating vulnerabilities across our systems, helping developers to produce secure code and evaluating new next-gen security technologies.
Respond to security and compliance issues generated via analysis or automated tools.
Work collaboratively cross-team, to impart your expertise across the organisation.
Be in the detail, working shoulder-to-shoulder with our technology teams.


Who You Are - some of the essential things required to be successful in the role


At least 2 years' experience in securing software or infrastructure in cloud platforms (e.g. Microsoft Azure)
Your experience should include;
Securing systems in line with 'Well Architected Frameworks' e.g. Azure Well Architected Framework
Network expoerience – whether designing and building, managing or troubleshooting – you should have experience and confidence in your networking knowledge
Applying security to networks, hosts, web applications and cloud native deployments
Working with toolsets such as: asset management, vulnerability management, firewalls, SIEM, PAM, IDS/IPS, EDR/XDR, DLP, SWG, WAF, CSPM, CNAPP
Designing, deploying, or managing code security controls to support SAST / DAST / IAST / RASP deployments in our environment
You should also:
Be well versed in securing Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment practices
Understand current attack tactics, techniques and procedures along with the use of MITRE Attack framework
Be inquisitive, have a passion for what you do and understanding how your work impacts and contributes ESO's success


Who You Are – it's desirable if you have any of the following


Exposure to Infrastructure as Code and Azure native technologies
Experience with threat modelling, NIST and CIS frameworks
Knowledge of application security standards such as OWASP Top 10, SANS / CWE 25


Benefits and Perks


Paid Vacation: 31 days of paid vacation plus 9 public holidays, to recharge and connect with family and friends.
Meal Vouchers: Access to delicious meals and snacks during your workday.
Connection: Free business phone and an internet connection at home.
Hybrid Workforce: Flexible options to perform your role from our Naerum office or from home as needed.
Pension Scheme: A tailor made scheme to meet your needs.
Career Development & Training: Benefit from career development programs, mentorship opportunities, training sessions, and paths for advancement.
Inclusive Workplace: a diverse, equitable, and inclusive global workplace where all people feel supported, and creativity and new ideas are encouraged.
Employee Referral Bonus Program: Earn bonuses for referring talented individuals to join our team.


Are you ready to Make a Difference?

ESO is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We invite you to consider opportunities at ESO regardless of your gender; gender identity; gender reassignment; age; religious or similar philosophical belief; race; national origin; political opinion; sexual orientation; disability; marital or civil partnership status, or other non-merit factor.

Applicant Privacy Notice – please click here to review the applicant privacy notice which details how your data is collected, used and protected.
Show more

We invite you to consider opportunities at ESO regardless of your gender; gender identity; gender reassignment; age; religious or similar philosophical belief; race; national origin; political opinion; sexual orientation; disability; marital or civil partnership status, or other non-merit factor.

Applicant Privacy Notice – please click here to review the applicant privacy notice which details how your data is collected, used and protected.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us to shape the future of endoscopy!

Do you want to be part of bringing the cutting-edge application of computer vision and deep learning to the medical field and building a new market within single-use endoscopy? 

Then this might be your defining moment. Join Ambu's Algorithms team and play a pivotal role in revolutionizing healthcare imaging!

Key Responsibilities As Computer Vision Engineer

In this role, you will be part of a team that explores computer vision and AI opportunities, from concept to final product. Your main responsibility will be to design and implement algorithms utilizing computer vision and deep learning. You should expect that a large part of your work will be centered around prototyping, data collection in the lab and getting the software to a production ready state.

Your main tasks will be focused on, but not limited to:


Algorithm development and implementation
Data handling, processing and quality assurance
Data management on servers and in databases, including cleanup
Documentation


Suggested candidate profile

Role

Setting you up for success is one of our cornerstones. In order to do so, we imagine, you have in-depth knowledge of deep learning theory and applications. This role is flexible and can be tailored for both recent graduates and experienced professionals. You are likely to succeed in this position if you have:


An educational background within software, image processing (computer vision), physics, or similar fields
3-10 years of experience working with computer vision, e.g. camera calibration, stereo vision etc.
Experience in real-time image processing e.g. denoising, sharpening etc.
Experience in image quality analysis and with cameras, sensors, or lenses
Experience with C++/python and Pytorch/Tensorflow and with using CUDA or other GPU-programming libraries
Experience in G-streamer and Linux
Accustomed to working with git or similar versioning tools


You are highly motivated with a strong sense of detail. You have the ability to cross-collaborate with different teams. You have a proactive and flexible mind-set combined with the ability to plan, execute, and meet deadlines. You manage to focus, prioritize, and document your results.

 

It is essential that you have excellent communication and English skills, both written and oral, and that you are willing to travel approximately 5-10 days per year when feasible and safe. In this position you are allowed to work from home up to 2 days per week.

How To Apply 

We will invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis so don't hesitate to apply. 

You can get more information about the job and about Ambu by Head of Algorithms, Andreas Härstedt Jørgensen at ajor@ambu.com
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer til Data Foundation
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du forme fremtidens ML-platform hos TV 2 Danmark?

Vi søger en dygtig specialist inden for machine learning engineering, der er passioneret omkring at sætte machine learning-modeller i produktion og vil være med til at videreudvikle TV 2s ML-platform, som understøtter TV 2s digitale vækst. Her får du muligheden for at bringe dine tekniske evner i spil og bidrage til et miljø kendetegnet ved høj faglighed og samarbejde.

Om afdelingen og teamet

I Data Foundation bliver du en del af Data Platform-teamet, som arbejder målrettet på at gøre data tilgængeligt og værdiskabende for hele TV 2. Teamet består af seks erfarne data engineers og en ML engineer, der sammen skaber løsninger til både store strategiske projekter og daglige udfordringer. Her får du mulighed for at arbejde i et miljø med høj faglighed, hvor samarbejde med eksperter inden for data science, analyse og visualisering er en del af hverdagen.

Rollen – vær med til at sikre TV 2 lykkes med machine learning og AI

Som ML engineer får du en central rolle i videreudviklingen af vores ML-platform, der bidrager til at vores data scientist kan få modeller fra udvikling til produktion. Derudover vil du blive ansvarlig for at skabe løsninger, der er skalerbare, effektive og klar til at understøtte TV 2s ambitioner inden for machine learning og AI.

Dine primære opgaver vil være at:



Produktionssætning af ML-modeller: Arbejd tæt med data scientists for at sikre robuste og værdiskabende løsninger.
Udvikling og vedligehold af ML-platformen: Udnyt Databricks og Azure-services til at skabe morgendagens ML-platform i TV 2, der understøtter fremtidige behov inden for ML og AI.
Byg CI/CD-pipelines: Design og implementér workflows med GitHub Actions.
Overvågning og sikkerhed: Sørg for stabil drift og høj kvalitet af produktionssatte løsninger.
Teknisk sparringspartner: Definér udviklingsprincipper og vær en teknisk sparringspartner på tværs af organisationen.



Dit arbejdssted kan være i København eller Odense.

Om dig

For at lykkes i denne rolle forestiller vi os, at du:



Har en teknisk baggrund inden for matematik, datalogi, data science eller et beslægtet felt.
Har et par års professionel erfaring med machine learning engineering eller beslægtede felter.
Forstår machine learning-projekters livscyklus – fra dataforberedelse til implementering.
Er velbevandret i Python og har kendskab til frameworks som MLflow og scikit-learn.
Erfaring med at arbejde på cloud-platforme som Azure, AWS eller Google.
Fortrolig med software engineering best practices og CI/CD-pipelines.
Har kendskab til containerization og REST API’er.



Det vigtigste er, at du har interesse i at udvikle dig og bidrage til videreudviklingen af vores ML-platform i et miljø, hvor samarbejde og faglig udvikling er i fokus

TV 2 som arbejdsplads

I TV 2s teknologiske område arbejder mere end 350 medarbejdere dedikeret med at understøtte og realisere den koncernstrategiske målsætning om 1,3 millioner Play-abonnenter i 2025.

Målsætningen, der udspringer af 2025-strategien 'TV 2 Play til alle', forudsætter et solidt teknologisk fundament, der gør det muligt for TV 2 også i fremtiden at levere dansk kvalitetsindhold og public service, som danskerne har let adgang til og interesse i at samles om.

TV 2 investerer derfor i disse år massivt i udviklingen og driften af hele den teknologiske værdikæde fra medieteknologi og tv-produktion til digital produktudvikling. Alt sammen med det formål at sikre, at vi imødekommer danskernes behov og forventninger i et omskifteligt marked med stigende, international konkurrence.

Teknologiorganisationen er placeret i både Odense og København, og vi beskæftiger blandt andre Software Engineers, UX-designere, Product Managers, Solution Architects, produktionsspecialister og Data Scientists.

Søg rollen

Du sender din ansøgning med CV via formularen nedenunder. Vi holder løbende samtaler, og lukker stillingen når de rette kandidater er fundet.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!


Show more

Teknologiorganisationen er placeret i både Odense og København, og vi beskæftiger blandt andre Software Engineers, UX-designere, Product Managers, Solution Architects, produktionsspecialister og Data Scientists.

Title: Freelance AI Security Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About The Company

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

Our goal? Advance the field of artificial intelligence through collaborative Generative AI projects with domain experts. The Mindrift platform allows experts to dive into a variety of tasks ranging from creating training prompts for AI models to refining AI responses for better relevance.

You'll have the unique opportunity to contribute to AI development anywhere, at anytime. Flexible, community-focused, and innovative—without the need for developer skills.

About The Role

Generative AI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills.

In this role, you will use your skills to train AI systems to identify and exploit security weaknesses in a controlled and ethical manner.

Your role will involve designing and executing a code injection attack to identify vulnerabilities in an AI-powered computer agent. You'll receive an onboarding session and sample documentation to guide you through the process. In practice, this means working with Docker containers, writing Bash and Python scripts, modifying HTML files, crafting malicious Linux commands, etc..

Requirements

Required Qualifications:


Strong Linux administration and automation skills (Bash, Python, PowerShell)
Hands-on experience with penetration testing tools (Metasploit, Burp Suite, Nessus, Nmap)
Knowledge of AI security risks, including prompt injection, adversarial attacks, and AI red teaming
Experience in automating security tasks, securing DevOps workflows, and integrating security into CI/CD pipelines
Cloud security expertise (AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD security)
Relevant security certifications (OSCP, CEH, CISSP, OSWE, API Security Architect)
Proficiency in English: advanced (C1) or above
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills for reporting findings and collaborating with teams
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Preferred Skills:


Experience in AI red teaming, adversarial ML, LLM security testing
Deep understanding of networking protocols, OS security, and web application security
Knowledge of OWASP Top Ten, MITRE ATT&CK, and other security frameworks
Experience with web security (HTTP, API security, web scraping, DOM manipulation)



Benefits

Why you should apply for this freelance role:


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that works with your schedule and commitments
Be part of an exciting AI project
Enrich your portfolio with new experience
Make a tangible impact on the quality of AI
Show more

Title: R Developer | Life Sciences
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you enjoy software development in R? Can you build production ready tools that bring value to the Life Sciences sector?

If so, this is the perfect opportunity you.

What We Do

ADC is a Data & AI Consultancy committed to the responsible adoption of data and AI, driving real impact for organizations that matter. We help clients achieve their goals through data-driven solutions, with deep industry expertise.

What makes ADC unique is our impact-driven and collaborative approach. Our team is composed of top talent dedicated to leveraging their advanced data and AI expertise for the greater good. We work with our clients, not just for them, empowering pragmatic and comprehensive consultants through inclusivity, trust, and ownership. We aim to grow across Europe creating the leading data and AI consultancy. Join us on our growth journey!

For this role it is required for you to be based in Denmark.

Requirements

What you do:


Deliver value to our clients by helping them develop the best data-driven solutions. These solutions can be strategic (companies that want to become more data-driven) and/or implementation-oriented (data-driven analyses and building data-science support tools)
Conduct complex statistical analysis in programming languages such as R and Python
Work hands-on in the cloud: configuring/provisioning infrastructure, building CI/CD pipelines, and ensuring good monitoring
Collaborate with a team of professionals with whom you are building a fast-growing company
Develop and challenge yourself during in- and external knowledge-sharing and training sessions
Be a brand ambassador by embracing our company values: comprehensive, pragmatic, trust and ownership


What You Bring


+3 years of working experience in areas such as Data Science, Advanced Analytics or Artificial Intelligence, and Statistical Analysis
A quantitative MSc and/or PhD degree (e.g., Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics, Data Science, AI, Computer Science)
Strong analytics foundation and hands-on experience with performing analysis and visualisations in R
Some hands-on experience deploying to the cloud (e.g. provisioning infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, monitoring)
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Databricks is a big plus
Experience in the Life Sciences sector is a big plus
Consultancy experience is a big plus
Familiarity with basic principles of software development, design and agile development
Excellent command of the English language and communication skills


What We Offer


A steep learning curve through taking on responsibility from day one
Projects in which you can immerse yourself in challenges to make a positive impact
Freedom to realize your own initiatives and implement your ideas
A training programme focusing on your self-development, designed to transform people into trusted advisors, specialists, and ADC leaders
A knowledge-sharing culture in the form of peer groups, project presentations
Our Collective Week, a workcation with the entirety of ADC during which we work on pro bono projects and make unforgettable memories
A welcoming office space in the centre of Copenhagen, with daily lunches provided by a nearby restaurant
Various social events, including Friday drinks, monthly first Friday events, sports activities, etc.


What To Do Next

If you are inspired by this opportunity, apply at the link below!

For questions, please contact us at recruitment@adc-consulting.com


ADC is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and promote equality to shape a better future. No characteristics are discriminated against, as indicated in Directive 2000/78/EC. We encourage and welcome all applications. Additional arrangements or adjustments to support your application can be discussed further.
Show more

If you are inspired by this opportunity, apply at the link below!

For questions, please contact us at recruitment@adc-consulting.com

  • ADC is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and promote equality to shape a better future. No characteristics are discriminated against, as indicated in Directive 2000/78/EC. We encourage and welcome all applications. Additional arrangements or adjustments to support your application can be discussed further.

Title: Research Scientist for R&D Organic Chemistry, Novonesis
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new research scientist

Are you an enthusiastic and skilled organic chemist looking to make a significant impact? Join our organic chemistry team! You will be the second scientist in our team, working alongside two dedicated laboratory technicians. Based in the Department of Enzymology, Substrates & Assays, you will support Novonesis’ R&D projects with in-house syntheses, analytical tasks, purifications, and provide expert consultation on organic chemistry.

Expect to dive into a variety of exciting tasks including, but not limited to, the synthesis of small molecules used in enzymatic assays, the design of new non-conventional assays, bioconjugation and immobilization, fractionation and characterization of natural substrates, the studying of enzyme-substrate interactions, and generally contribute to our research projects with molecular understanding from an organic chemistry perspective where your contributions will bring valuable molecular insights to our research projects. As part of a small agile team, the ideal candidate will be motivated to take on tasks within all mentioned fields and you will have the opportunity to grow your expertise across multiple fields.

Welcome to Enzymology, Substrates & Assays

The department consists of 24 scientists and technicians located in our Innovation Campus in Lyngby. The department has a strong science focus and builds on values characterized by passion, experience, and professionalism. We are organized into specialized teams being an enzymology team, an assay team, and the organic chemistry team. Further, we also work in cross-departmental teams in an agile setup where we use our different competences to drive and support innovation projects. We contribute to new product development by generating and sharing innovative ideas, building application relevant screening assays, understanding complex substrate/enzymes interactions and through in-depth knowledge help guide enzyme candidate selection in projects. By covering a wide range of industries, this position enables you to contribute to the development of sustainable products for diverse applications such as food, dairy, baking, human health, bioenergy, and household care.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By


Working on parallel research projects by being part of a project team with chemists and laboratory technicians across departments and countries. It is expected that you thrive on managing several tasks at the same time
Exploring and developing new technologies in-house or via external collaborations, where your collaborative mindset and learning capability are crucial
Being a strong team player who can independently plan and execute analyses in the laboratory
Identifying areas where your skillset can have an impact in the niche area of organic chemistry at Novonesis, build a network and initiate collaborations


To Succeed You Must Have


A PhD in organic chemistry or a Master’s degree with equivalent work experience
Strong scientific background with critical thinking skills and ability to formulate ideas for experiments from diverse data/knowledge inputs and application/business relevant project needs
A “go do it” attitude, translating to hands-on laboratory work, independently and together with lab technicians
Strong communication skills, an open-minded and positive attitude, and a desire to achieve results together with others


Additional we expect you to be a team player and to be fluent in English as you will work closely with colleagues of many different nationalities.

It Is An Advantage If You Have


Knowledge and working experience with enzymes and assays
Hands-on experience with running and maintaining analytical instruments, including NMR, LC-MS, and GC


Are you our next colleague in our team? Become a part of Novonesis and unfold your potential with us.

Place

Novonesis Innovation Campus

Biologiens Vej 2

2800 Kongens Lyngby, Greater Copenhagen

Danmark

Do you have a passion for sustainable solutions, and can you see yourself in this position? So, follow your passion and apply today!

Application deadline: 24 February 2025.

Contact information: For more information, please contact Senior Department Manager Søren Flensted Lassen (sfl@novonesis.com) or Science Manager Jesper Brask (jebk@novonesis.com ).

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.
