Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.




In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks
Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines
Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About you

Fluency within mathematics and statistics
Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
Proficiency with computer science fundamentals
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Place: Ballerup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be part of a growing team and play a crucial role in helping us deliver the best software for our research equipment?




Sophion was founded in year 2000 by a group of passionate electrophysiologists, all having the shared goal of making patch clamping objective and independent of user skills to provide faster, more accurate and objective results. We are an innovative, rapidly expanding company that has developed from a startup into a global organization, while maintaining the passion and drive to provide solutions for high performance cell analysis.




Today the company’s analytical platforms QPatch, QPatch Compact and Qube are placed at leading pharmaceutical companies, Contract Research Organizations, and world’s best universities. With our dedicated support and service, this ensures us a leading position in the market. We try our best to be a great company to work for; fun, fulfilling and always challenging as we compete in a fast-moving market and industry.




What we are looking for:




About the position

As our new DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for updating and maintaining our integrations and delivery tools and processes, as well as building new ones for our next R&D projects. You will be part of the Software Engineering Team, a team rich of 6 talented engineers. You will be expected to bring new ideas, and a fresh look on our code standards, influencing not only the Software Team, but also other developers across the organization (hardware engineers, firmware engineers, system engineers).

You possess strong communication skills and appreciate sharing and explaining your work. As much as your listening skills are important to understand and value the systems already in place, your ideas will need to be communicated across different teams, to different profiles.

Being a team player in our organization is a must!




Main Responsibilities

Migrate existing repositories from SVN to git.
Enhance and streamline build pipelines on Jenkins for all software projects.
Create new pipelines for new R&D projects.
Develop and improve internal tools for production workers, focusing on database-based solutions.
Set up and manage an Artifactory server for software artifacts.
Improve unit tests and automatic tests infrastructure.
Improve our delivery processes.
Stay on top of the industry standards on DevOps tools and practices and advise the rest of the Software Engineering Team




Key Qualifications

BSc in IT, Computer Science, or other related fields.
At least 5 years of DevOps experience, preferably in R&D companies.
Proficiency in VCS (SVN and git).
Expertise in build automation and pipeline optimization in Jenkins.
Experience with Artifactory, AWS, Gradle, Docker.
Familiarity with SQL databases is a plus.
Familiarity with C++, or Java, or C#, is a plus.




Personal Qualities

Highly driven and motivated work ethic.
A team player that works well in a dynamic environment, in cross-functional teams.
Enthusiastic, self-driven, and enjoy solving complicated problems with a general technical flair and a “can do, will do” mindset.
Able to communicate fluently in English both speaking and writing.
Able to step in when colleagues need help, and it comes naturally for you to ask for help when needed.
Motivated by learning and adapting to new challenges.




If you have any questions, please contact the hiring manager:




Antoine Wajntraub

+45 22 39 80 27




Deadline: We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible. The application deadline will close as we find the right candidate. So please apply now via LinkedIn.

Title: Fullstack Software Engineer II
Description:
We are growing our engineering teams at Trustpilot and are looking to welcome onboard mid-level Fullstack Software Engineers to join our Growth team!




You will join a cross-functional team with full ownership of our products and codebase, where you will take part in every step of the development process, from ideation to maintenance. A place where you can grow as an individual, while also having an influence on the direction of projects and technological choices.




What you’ll be doing:

You will guide mid-sized projects that will align with the mission and OKRs of your team
Work in a cross-functional “full ownership” team alongside Product, Design, and Data Science where you will take part in every step of the process of building, from ideation and design to architecture, code, deployment, and maintenance
Collaboration: Take part in decision-making and design discussions during the development
Contribute to planning, implementation, and release of new features
Propose ideas clearly and contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes and tools
Troubleshoot existing software
Assist us in raising the bar: Inspire and influence those around you with your knowledge of how to solve problems
Data-driven mindset: Analyse, gather, and aggregate data to support decisions, both technical and non-technical




Who you are:

Fullstack web development experience as a must-have
Cloud expertise, specifically hands-on experience with AWS, serverless architecture, data pipelines, and event-driven systems
Proficiency in back-end technologies like Node.js and component-based front-end development using React
Experience leading feature development and deploying software to production at scale
A strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines, post-deployment monitoring, and incident management
Expertise in developing RESTful APIs and distributed cloud services
A customer-centric, solution-oriented mindset with a bias for action
You are a lifelong learner. You promote a culture of continuous feedback and learning
Ambitious and enthusiastic about your work. You constantly look to raise the bar for yourself and those around you in everything you do
You believe that diversity in teams makes a difference




Some relevant technologies and services we use:

Infrastructure: AWS (ECS, Lambda, SNS, SQS, CloudFormation ...), Docker
Languages: Typescript, Javascript
Frontend: React, Next.js, CSS Modules, SASS, Styled Components
Database: DynamoDB, PostgreSQL, BigQuery

Find more on: http://stackshare.io/trustpilot




What’s in it for you:

A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops




Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

Title: Machine Learning Weather Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further. Does this sound highly appealing to you?

Then you might be our new Machine Learning (ML) Weather Researcher at Alipes Capital.




About the Role

Alipes began trading in the Energy sector in 2022. We use machine learning technology for reading and interpreting fundamental and market data and execute our trading strategies based on this data. Since our inception in 2008, we have continuously grown and diversified into new business areas driven by our technology. Alipes aims to support liquid power markets and free flow of energy, which are crucial to facilitate the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources, thereby promoting a sustainable future.




Forecasting power generation from renewables is crucial for price discovery, risk management and for balancing the power grid. Recent advances in ML/AI/Neural based weather modeling promise models which are orders of magnitude faster to run than traditional physics-based numerical weather models.




Your work as our new ML Weather Researcher will involve turning massive data sets of weather data into machine learning models that accurately predict short-term weather patterns and power production from renewables.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult. We are centrally located in Copenhagen and have 55 bright and ambitious team members.




About the Team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative analysts covering 6 nationalities – a combination of PhD’s and MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and economists that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About You

Experience with ML/AI/Neural-based weather forecasting (GraphCast etc)
Experience with Deep Learning and Neural Networks
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science or relevant field
Familiar with terms like ECMWF IFS, HRRR, GFS, GOES etc.
Proficiency within computer science fundamentals, mathematics and statistics
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
A scientific and inquisitive mind




What we can Offer You

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more
HTML:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further. Does this sound highly appealing to you?

Then you might be our new Machine Learning (ML) Weather Researcher at Alipes Capital.


About the Role

Alipes began trading in the Energy sector in 2022. We use machine learning technology for reading and interpreting fundamental and market data and execute our trading strategies based on this data. Since our inception in 2008, we have continuously grown and diversified into new business areas driven by our technology. Alipes aims to support liquid power markets and free flow of energy, which are crucial to facilitate the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources, thereby promoting a sustainable future.


Forecasting power generation from renewables is crucial for price discovery, risk management and for balancing the power grid. Recent advances in ML/AI/Neural based weather modeling promise models which are orders of magnitude faster to run than traditional physics-based numerical weather models.


Your work as our new ML Weather Researcher will involve turning massive data sets of weather data into machine learning models that accurately predict short-term weather patterns and power production from renewables.


You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult. We are centrally located in Copenhagen and have 55 bright and ambitious team members.


About the Team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative analysts covering 6 nationalities – a combination of PhD’s and MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and economists that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.


About You

  • Experience with ML/AI/Neural-based weather forecasting (GraphCast etc)
  • Experience with Deep Learning and Neural Networks
  • PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science or relevant field
  • Familiar with terms like ECMWF IFS, HRRR, GFS, GOES etc.
  • Proficiency within computer science fundamentals, mathematics and statistics
  • Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
  • A scientific and inquisitive mind


What we can Offer You

  • Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
  • Exciting problems to solve
  • Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
  • Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
  • Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation


Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you have a strategic and analytical mindset? Do you possess a proactive attitude and thrive in a dynamic environment? Do you fancy a career as a data scientist in Denmark’s largest retailer?

Then you might be our new colleague

We are looking for business minded colleagues to be part of our newly established Supply Chain Development team in Netto.

You and the team will have the responsibility of driving strategic projects across business units, namely Netto, føtex and Bilka, utilizing and processing the huge amount of data available in Salling Group leading to insights that enable more informed business decision-making creating a difference for our customers.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities


Through data analyses create insights to support core retail processes regarding e.g. product availability across stores and distribution centres
Together with the team, design, develop and implement tools and models that utilize the data to create business impact in new ways
Ensure efficient data availability including tailor-build tools
Support the general data-driven transformation across Salling Group
Drive step-change improvements to core forecasting and allocation IT infrastructure in close collaboration with internal and external stakeholders


Your Skills And Background

You have a Master’s degree within economics, IT, engineering or other natural science degrees (e.g. cand.scient, cand.oecon, cand.merc). Preferably, you have a couple of years’ of experience as a data scientist or in a similar role, where you have acquired the necessary skills to succeed as a data scientist.

Alternatively, you compensate for your lack of experience by being a top-performer and by having relevant experience in a student job during your studies. You have a natural interest in data and how it can be utilized to create business impact. Beside your passion for data, you have a strong business acumen enabling you to utilize the right data and making the best analysis for the problem at hand.

You have an analytical mindset, a structured way of working and is a real problem-solver. You have experience with extracting, cleaning and transforming data as well as data modelling creating measures and reports that support solid business decisions across Salling Group.

You have experience with programming/scripting languages such as R, Python, VBA, DAX and SQL.

As a person you are curious of nature and have an eagerness to take on a very steep learning-curve. You are proactive and have a ‘self-starter attitude’ and can independently focus, see opportunities and invite yourself to the table. As you will interact with many stakeholders in the organization, you must also have personal presence and the ability to present your points convincingly.

Fluency in Danish is a prerequisite.

We offer


An exciting career with a steep learning curve in an international company in continued growth, giving you extensive opportunity for both personal and professional growth
A diversified job with impact and responsibilities
Being part of a highly professional team in a dynamic environment offering you deep insights in retail
Competitive salary package and benefits


Are you the person for the job?

Send your application, resume and copy of your grades as soon as possible - and no later than 2 March 2025 – through the link on this page.

Please note that applications will be assessed on an ongoing basis and therefore the job application may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have proceeded with candidates to the screening or interview phase

Feel free to contact: Head of Supply Chain and Logistics, Nikolaj Holm Hansen, at +45 2363 9188 if you have further inquiries on the position.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Junior Software Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're Catalysta, a SaaS solution helping organizations track, report, and reduce their greenhouse gas emissions. Our platform is based on first-hand learnings from 100+ GHG accounting projects and 20.000+ hours of work.

We raised a pre-seed round in November, onboarded Senior Developers and Head of UX through December and January, and have a pipeline of potential customers. We're now looking for a talented individual to help accelerate our pace of development and join us on our mission to make sustainability impact more transparent and actionable.

You will be working closely with the rest of the founding team to create a great product experience. 2025 is the year we will be launching our product and our focus now is on building the MVP.

This is a full-stack developer role but with emphasis on front-end. We build our platform in Django and our front-end is based on HTML templating, Bootstrap, and HTMX.

The role is based in central Copenhagen near Nørreport Station, and please note that we work from the office with some remote work flexibility. We collaborate closely in the team and discuss challenges as they come up. We share office space with the leading sustainability consultancy in the Nordics.

Responsibilities


Architecture & Development: Participate in the overall architectural decisions and implementation of the Catalysta platform.
Technology Selection: Drive the selection of appropriate technologies, frameworks, and tools for the application’s development, deployment, and scaling.
Collaboration: Work closely with the developer team to translate business needs into technical solutions, ensuring the development process aligns with the long-term goals of the company.
Quality Assurance: Ensuring security and maintaining high standards of quality are crucial in this domain. We believe in achieving this through continuous, small improvements, quick user feedback, and thorough testing. We expect that you embody these principles.

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms
Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses
Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies




You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.




The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).




We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.




Need to have

Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model
Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models
Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)
A meticulous and detail-oriented mind




Nice to have

Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)
Working with financial/trading data
Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java
Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)
Degree in Computer Science / Engineering




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. In your cover letter, if applicable, please describe a project where you extracted structured or unstructured information from text - including the techniques, tools, models used and how those extractions informed further decisions/predictions.

If you're selected for an interview, we will be very interested in discussing technical details with you about this project!

Should your profile look like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more
HTML:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.


At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.


Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

  • Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms
  • Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses
  • Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies


You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.


The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).


We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.


Need to have

  • Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model
  • Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models
  • Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
  • Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)
  • A meticulous and detail-oriented mind


Nice to have

  • Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)
  • Working with financial/trading data
  • Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java
  • Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)
  • Degree in Computer Science / Engineering


What we can offer you

  • Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
  • Exciting problems to solve
  • Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
  • Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
  • Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation


Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. In your cover letter, if applicable, please describe a project where you extracted structured or unstructured information from text - including the techniques, tools, models used and how those extractions informed further decisions/predictions.

If you're selected for an interview, we will be very interested in discussing technical details with you about this project!

Should your profile look like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: MLOps Engineer with Python
Description:
We invite you to join a project for one of our clients, an international company, one of the biggest sports brands in the world.

We seek a highly skilled MLOps Engineer to build automation to enable machine learning engineers to continuously deliver predictive analytics for performance, forecasting, personalization, and inventory optimization. You will work with a team of architects, platform engineers, and machine learning engineers to come up with new and interesting models, test them, and productionalize and scale them in the cloud as APIs, stream processing, or massive batch processing. We are looking for a high-energy individual with experience developing cloud-native applications, APIs, and data pipelines that value automation, testing, and security. You will orchestrate cloud, containers, big data, parallel processing technologies, advanced analytics, machine learning, and deep learning techniques to quantitatively plan product demand, allocate resources, and target the right customers with the best products.




Your tasks

Create cloud infrastructure for machine learning following the MLOps model
Develop and implement public and internal APIs
Design event and streaming-based services
Build Tests and Build a Pipeline for automated Deployment
Establish Monitoring and Alerting for custom infrastructure
Worki with batch data pipelines for machine learning for massive data sets
Support investigation of new cloud services, software packages/tools, APIs, container management, and distributed systems, to continuously deliver quality analytics and machine learning at scale
Cooperate with a cross-functional agile team of software engineers, data engineers, ML experts, and others to build new product features
Enable rapid iteration and product quality through continuous A/B testing
Design, implement, and maintain solutions/platforms
Collaborate with platform engineering and architects to utilize best practices and maintain compliance




Requirements

At least 5 years of demonstrated experience in enabling MLOps
Experience with system configuration management tools, such as Ansible, Puppet, or Chef
Knowledge of CI/CD infrastructure using Git, Jenkins, or similar tools
Proficiency with Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, containers, and related tools and systems
Background with AWS components and services, particularly, IAM, ECS/EKS, EMR, S3, and Lambda/Serverless
Prefer infrastructure as code experience with CloudFormation or Terraform
Strong Python, shell scripting, and SQL
Familiarity with Spark, Databricks, Snowflake
Attention to agile development processes, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, software engineering, or related field preferred
Show more

Title: Nordic Full-Stack Data Scientist - L'Oréal Nordic - Copenhagen
Description:
A Day in the Life!

As the Nordic Full-Stack Data Scientist, you will be joining the CDMO Data Team, a centralized transformation driver supporting all business divisions and functions. Our mission is to propel the business towards the future of Data & Analytics, collaborating closely with Regional HQ & Global teams while serving as an agile business partner for local stakeholders. Your work will be directly linked to our business strategy, influencing how we interpret, plan, and execute client-centric initiatives.

In this dynamic role, flexibility and adaptability are key as we navigate and learn. Your core responsibilities will include:

Data Integration: Building seamless data flows between various internal and external sources.

Analytics Development: Developing datasets and analytical models to address specific business needs.

Insight Enhancement: Creating statistical, predictive, and gap-filling data models to enrich our understanding of our business & retailers.

Solution Design: Developing user-friendly front-end analytics solutions using PowerBI, enabling stakeholders to access and interpret data effectively.

Global Alignment: Implementing core Group analytics solutions in the Nordics, ensuring consistency and scalability within Group compliance.

Project Orchestration: Proactively managing projects and stakeholders, aligning with our roadmap to deliver impactful results.

Collaboration: Working closely with Global & Zone technical teams to ensure solutions are scalable and compliant with Group standards.

We Are Looking For

Technical Expertise: Proficiency in Google Cloud Platform (Cloud Functions & Cloud Projects), BigQuery, Azure (Functions & Logic Apps), SQL, Python, R, SFTP, APIs, PowerBI (DAX, Data modeling & Data visualization), and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, PowerApps).

Data-Driven Mindset: A passion for leveraging data to drive business decisions and a proven ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.

Collaborative Spirit: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to bridge the gap between business and technical stakeholders.

Proactive Approach: A self-starter with a proactive and innovative mindset enabling continuous progress.

Strategic Thinking: A solid understanding of our data strategy & framework, our business objectives activities and ability to scope solutions within.

Solution-Oriented: Ability to deliver sustainable and scalable solutions that meet long-term business needs.

We are looking for you to start as soon as we have found YOU. The employment is permanent. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so do not wait to apply. We welcome everyone to apply no matter your gender, ethnicity, physical abilities, religion, or sexual orientation.

What’s In It For You


A place for you to challenge yourself and grow beyond your potential (here, you’ll be encouraged to try new things!). Real responsibility from day 1, there’s no sitting on the sidelines at L’Oréal.
An environment where people of every ethnicity, social background, age, religion, gender, and sexual orientation as well as people with disabilities are accepted, can speak up, will thrive and are celebrated!
A place where you can contribute to something bigger! Many of our brands have societal /environmental causes to make concrete difference.


Who We Are

L’Oréal is present in 150 markets on five continents. For more than a century, L’Oréal has devoted itself solely to ‘Create beauty that moves the world’; it is now the industry world leader with €42 billion consolidated sales. Together, we solve complex challenges at scale, while making sure we stay committed to making the world a more inclusive and a better place for everyone & our planet.

Today, L’Oréal includes over 9k experts in beauty tech, digital, data and e-comm and is constantly growing. Championing Beauty Tech, we invent the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.

We’re committed to guaranteeing inclusive recruitment processes and to advocating for hiring and promoting each candidate in an ethical and equitable way. The Group strictly prohibits discrimination against any applicant for employment because of the individual’s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, visible and/or invisible disabilities, socio-economic and/or multicultural origins, health conditions, age, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law.
Show more

Title: Security Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
How You'll Support Our Mission

ESO's teams are growing, and our software is in demand globally by firefighters, paramedics, hospitals and governments. To meet this demand, we are building an industry-leading cyber security team in Belfast to protect our customers and data from a variety of fast moving and constantly evolving threats.

We are looking for Security Engineers to join our Copenhagen, Belfast and US teams. Work alongside our fire, hospital and EMS Engineering teams to secure our mission-critical applications. These applications are used to help our customers go about their daily job of protecting their communities and saving lives.

You will be helping to design and implement systems using techniques such as defence in depth, threat modelling and zero trust across Microsoft Azure cloud native technologies.

Our security engineers have a high degree of autonomy, and are part of a high functioning, motivated and forward-thinking team. You have the chance to join a diverse, growing and passionate team, working on critical products, whilst being supported with training opportunities and mentoring.

Joining our team will be an amazing and truly rewarding experience.

What You'll Be Doing – the day to day


Have significant impact on the security of our systems that are used by thousands of fire fighters, paramedics and hospitals worldwide.
Be a key part of our cyber security team, with demonstrable impact on the security of our systems and applications. 
Help our teams to model threats using the STRIDE model, against new designs, ensuring appropriate protection and controls are in place.
Make a difference by mitigating vulnerabilities across our systems, helping developers to produce secure code and evaluating new next-gen security technologies.
Respond to security and compliance issues generated via analysis or automated tools.
Work collaboratively cross-team, to impart your expertise across the organisation.
Be in the detail, working shoulder-to-shoulder with our technology teams.


Who You Are - some of the essential things required to be successful in the role


At least 2 years' experience in securing software or infrastructure in cloud platforms (e.g. Microsoft Azure)
Your experience should include;
Securing systems in line with 'Well Architected Frameworks' e.g. Azure Well Architected Framework
Network expoerience – whether designing and building, managing or troubleshooting – you should have experience and confidence in your networking knowledge
Applying security to networks, hosts, web applications and cloud native deployments
Working with toolsets such as: asset management, vulnerability management, firewalls, SIEM, PAM, IDS/IPS, EDR/XDR, DLP, SWG, WAF, CSPM, CNAPP
Designing, deploying, or managing code security controls to support SAST / DAST / IAST / RASP deployments in our environment
You should also:
Be well versed in securing Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment practices
Understand current attack tactics, techniques and procedures along with the use of MITRE Attack framework
Be inquisitive, have a passion for what you do and understanding how your work impacts and contributes ESO's success


Who You Are – it's desirable if you have any of the following


Exposure to Infrastructure as Code and Azure native technologies
Experience with threat modelling, NIST and CIS frameworks
Knowledge of application security standards such as OWASP Top 10, SANS / CWE 25


Benefits and Perks


Paid Vacation: 31 days of paid vacation plus 9 public holidays, to recharge and connect with family and friends.
Meal Vouchers: Access to delicious meals and snacks during your workday.
Connection: Free business phone and an internet connection at home.
Hybrid Workforce: Flexible options to perform your role from our Naerum office or from home as needed.
Pension Scheme: A tailor made scheme to meet your needs.
Career Development & Training: Benefit from career development programs, mentorship opportunities, training sessions, and paths for advancement.
Inclusive Workplace: a diverse, equitable, and inclusive global workplace where all people feel supported, and creativity and new ideas are encouraged.
Employee Referral Bonus Program: Earn bonuses for referring talented individuals to join our team.


Are you ready to Make a Difference?

ESO is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We invite you to consider opportunities at ESO regardless of your gender; gender identity; gender reassignment; age; religious or similar philosophical belief; race; national origin; political opinion; sexual orientation; disability; marital or civil partnership status, or other non-merit factor.

Applicant Privacy Notice – please click here to review the applicant privacy notice which details how your data is collected, used and protected.
Show more

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us to shape the future of endoscopy!

Do you want to be part of bringing the cutting-edge application of computer vision and deep learning to the medical field and building a new market within single-use endoscopy? 

Then this might be your defining moment. Join Ambu's Algorithms team and play a pivotal role in revolutionizing healthcare imaging!

Key Responsibilities As Computer Vision Engineer

In this role, you will be part of a team that explores computer vision and AI opportunities, from concept to final product. Your main responsibility will be to design and implement algorithms utilizing computer vision and deep learning. You should expect that a large part of your work will be centered around prototyping, data collection in the lab and getting the software to a production ready state.

Your main tasks will be focused on, but not limited to:


Algorithm development and implementation
Data handling, processing and quality assurance
Data management on servers and in databases, including cleanup
Documentation


Suggested candidate profile

Role

Setting you up for success is one of our cornerstones. In order to do so, we imagine, you have in-depth knowledge of deep learning theory and applications. This role is flexible and can be tailored for both recent graduates and experienced professionals. You are likely to succeed in this position if you have:


An educational background within software, image processing (computer vision), physics, or similar fields
3-10 years of experience working with computer vision, e.g. camera calibration, stereo vision etc.
Experience in real-time image processing e.g. denoising, sharpening etc.
Experience in image quality analysis and with cameras, sensors, or lenses
Experience with C++/python and Pytorch/Tensorflow and with using CUDA or other GPU-programming libraries
Experience in G-streamer and Linux
Accustomed to working with git or similar versioning tools


You are highly motivated with a strong sense of detail. You have the ability to cross-collaborate with different teams. You have a proactive and flexible mind-set combined with the ability to plan, execute, and meet deadlines. You manage to focus, prioritize, and document your results.

 

It is essential that you have excellent communication and English skills, both written and oral, and that you are willing to travel approximately 5-10 days per year when feasible and safe. In this position you are allowed to work from home up to 2 days per week.

How To Apply 

We will invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis so don't hesitate to apply. 

You can get more information about the job and about Ambu by Head of Algorithms, Andreas Härstedt Jørgensen at ajor@ambu.com
Show more

Title: Python Developer - 100 Work from home
Description:
Are you a Python Software Engineer, keen to join a company who are leading the way in developing and supplying cutting edge web applications for the education industry?Are you keen to work from home five days a week? As a Senior Python Developer, you will be building and maintaining web-based software products that will be used by schools across the UK, to enhance the learning experience kids are provided in todays era. We are looking for an experienced Python Coder, preferably with full stack capabilities across technologies such as Django and Vue, although the latter is not essential. This is a great opportunity to make your mark on the quality of education kids receive today…

Role: Python Developer aka Python Software Engineer, Python Programmer, Senior Python Developer, Software Developer

Location:100% work from home – occasional office visits in Buckinghamshire.

Salary:£40k - £50k salary DOE plus great benefits

What You Will Bring To The Table

You will be an experienced Python Developer with the skills and capabilities allowing you to work closely with the Head of Engineering, while taking the lead and autonomy on some pretty exciting innovative applications. You will have experience working as a Python Developer, preferably bringing experience of Django and Vue for visual data UI applications. Experience of Python Flask, PHP Laravel would be a bonus, but are non-essential skills as we have a team of PHP Developers. You will work on a variety of systems at any one time giving you great variety in the role.

If you like what you hear, please CLICK APPLY and send in a copy of your CV for immediate consideration.
Show more

Salary:£40k - £50k salary DOE plus great benefits

What You Will Bring To The Table

You will be an experienced Python Developer with the skills and capabilities allowing you to work closely with the Head of Engineering, while taking the lead and autonomy on some pretty exciting innovative applications. You will have experience working as a Python Developer, preferably bringing experience of Django and Vue for visual data UI applications. Experience of Python Flask, PHP Laravel would be a bonus, but are non-essential skills as we have a team of PHP Developers. You will work on a variety of systems at any one time giving you great variety in the role.

If you like what you hear, please CLICK APPLY and send in a copy of your CV for immediate consideration.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Graduate Data Scientist

Location: Birmingham, United Kingdom

Employment Type: Full-time




Are you a talented graduate with a passion for AI-driven solutions? Our client, an innovative technology company specializing in artificial intelligence and machine learning applications, is seeking a Graduate Data Scientist to join their team. This is an excellent opportunity to launch your career in a dynamic and forward-thinking environment.




About the Company:




Our client is a cutting-edge AI solutions provider that develops intelligent automation systems for industries such as finance, healthcare, and cybersecurity. Their proprietary AI models optimize business processes, enhance decision-making, and drive efficiency across various sectors.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop and implement machine learning models using Python and its associated data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Analyze complex datasets to extract valuable insights and drive data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI models into real-world applications.
Optimize algorithms for performance and scalability.
Communicate findings and recommendations through data visualizations and reports.




Requirements:




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Data Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python and key data science libraries.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Familiarity with machine learning techniques, data preprocessing, and statistical analysis.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team-oriented environment.




Desirable Skills:




Experience with cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Knowledge of big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop).
Understanding of deep learning frameworks.
Exposure to real-world AI applications or research projects.




What’s on Offer?




A collaborative and innovative work environment.
Exposure to industry-leading AI projects.
Ongoing professional development and career growth opportunities.
Competitive salary and benefits package.

Show more
